papers.abstract_zh: 量子纠缠能增加(经典)隐蔽信道的容量吗？对于一个熟悉Holevo定理的人来说，很容易认为答案显然是否定的。然而，在这项工作中，我们展示了:在存在活跃对手的情况下，量子纠缠实际上可以增加经典隐蔽信道的容量；另一方面，一个零容量的信道并没有因为纠缠而得到改善，因此纠缠无法创造出‘纯量子’的隐蔽信道；在纠缠存在的情况下确定给定信道的容量的问题是不可判定的；但是有一种算法可以从上面限制信道的纠缠容量，这种算法改编自非局部博弈理论的半定层次，它与信道容量的紧密联系是我们所有结果的核心。
papers.title_zh: 谨防希腊人背负纠缠？量子隐蔽通道、信息流和非局域博弈

papers.title: Cracking the Stateful Nut: Computational Proofs of Stateful Security Protocols using the Squirrel Proof Assistant
papers.authors: David Baelde, Stéphanie Delaune, Adrien Koutsos, Solène Moreau
papers.abstract: Bana and Comon have proposed a logical approach to proving protocols in the computational model, which they call the Computationally Complete Symbolic Attacker (CCSA). The proof assistant Squirrel implements a verification technique that elaborates on this approach, building on a meta-logic over the CCSA base logic. In this paper, we show that this meta-logic can naturally be extended to handle protocols with mutable states (key updates, counters, etc.) and we extend Squirrel'S proof system to be able to express the complex proof arguments that are sometimes required for these protocols. Our theoretical contributions have been implemented in Squirrel and validated on a number of case studies, including a proof of the YubiKey and YubiHSM protocols.
papers.abstract_zh: Bana和Comon提出了一种在计算模型中证明协议的逻辑方法，他们称之为计算完全符号攻击者(CCSA)。证明助手Squirrel实现了一种验证技术，详细阐述了这种方法，建立在CCSA基础逻辑之上的元逻辑之上。在本文中，我们表明这种元逻辑可以自然地扩展到处理具有可变状态(密钥更新、计数器等)的协议。)并且我们扩展了Squirrel的证明系统，使之能够表达这些协议有时需要的复杂证明论点。我们的理论贡献已经在Squirrel中实现，并在许多案例研究中得到验证，包括YubiKey和YubiHSM协议的证明。
papers.title_zh: 破解有状态坚果:使用松鼠证明助手对有状态安全协议的计算证明

papers.title: Exploiting Partial Order of Keys to Verify Security of a Vehicular Group Protocol
papers.authors: Felipe Boeira, Mikael Asplund
papers.abstract: Vehicular networks will enable a range of novel applications to enhance road traffic efficiency, safety, and reduce fuel consumption. As for other cyber-physical systems, security is essential to the deployment of these applications and standardisation efforts are ongoing. In this paper, we perform a systematic security evaluation of a vehicular platooning protocol through a thorough analysis of the protocol and security standards. We tackle the complexity of the resulting model with a proof strategy based on a relation on keys. The key relation forms a partial order, which encapsulates both secrecy and authenticity dependencies. We show that our order-aware approach makes the verification feasible and proves authenticity properties along with secrecy of all keys used throughout the protocol.
papers.abstract_zh: 车载网络将实现一系列新颖的应用，以提高道路交通效率、安全性并减少燃料消耗。至于其他网络物理系统，安全性对于这些应用的部署至关重要，标准化工作正在进行中。本文通过对协议和安全标准的深入分析，对一个车辆队列协议进行了系统的安全评估。我们使用基于键关系的证明策略来处理结果模型的复杂性。密钥关系形成了一个偏序，它封装了保密性和真实性依赖性。我们证明了我们的顺序感知方法使得验证可行，并且证明了协议中使用的所有密钥的真实性和保密性。
papers.title_zh: 利用密钥的偏序验证车辆群组协议的安全性

papers.title: Symbolic protocol verification with dice: process equivalences in the presence of probabilities
papers.authors: Vincent Cheval, Raphaëlle Crubillé, Steve Kremer
papers.abstract: Symbolic protocol verification generally abstracts probabilities away, considering computations that succeed only with negligible probability, such as guessing random numbers or breaking an encryption scheme, as impossible. This abstraction, sometimes referred to as the perfect cryptography assumption, has shown very useful as it simplifies automation of the analysis. However, probabilities may also appear in the control flow where they are generally not negligible. In this paper we consider a framework for symbolic protocol analysis with a probabilistic choice operator: the probabilistic applied pi calculus. We define and explore the relationships between several behavioral equivalences. In particular we show the need for randomized schedulers and exhibit a counter-example to a result in a previous work that relied on non-randomized ones. As in other frameworks that mix both non-deterministic and probabilistic choices, schedulers may sometimes be unrealistically powerful. We therefore consider two subclasses of processes that avoid this problem. In particular, when considering purely non-deterministic protocols, as is done in classical symbolic verification, we show that a probabilistic adversary has-maybe surprisingly-a strictly superior distinguishing power for may testing, which, when the number of sessions is bounded, we show to coincide with purely possibilistic similarity.
papers.abstract_zh: 符号协议验证通常将概率抽象掉，认为只有极小概率成功的计算(如猜测随机数或破解加密方案)是不可能的。这种抽象，有时被称为完美密码学假设，已经显示出非常有用，因为它简化了分析的自动化。然而，概率也可能出现在控制流中，它们通常是不可忽略的。在本文中，我们考虑了一个具有概率选择算子的符号协议分析框架:概率应用pi演算。我们定义并探索了几种行为等价之间的关系。特别是，我们展示了随机调度器的必要性，并展示了一个反例，与先前工作中依赖于非随机调度器的结果相反。正如在其他混合了非确定性和概率性选择的框架中一样，调度器有时可能不切实际地强大。因此，我们考虑避免这个问题的两个子类的过程。特别地，当考虑纯非确定性协议时，正如在经典符号验证中所做的那样，我们证明了概率对手在may测试中具有-也许令人惊讶地-严格优越的区分能力，当会话数量有限时，我们证明了这与纯可能性相似性相一致。
papers.title_zh: 用骰子进行符号协议验证:在概率存在的情况下处理等价性

papers.title: Machine-Checked Proofs of Privacy Against Malicious Boards for Selene & Co
papers.authors: Constantin Catalin Dragan, François Dupressoir, Ehsan Estaji, Kristian Gjøsteen, Thomas Haines, Peter Y. A. Ryan, Peter B. Rønne, Morten Rotvold Solberg
papers.abstract: Privacy is a notoriously difficult property to achieve in complicated systems and especially in electronic voting schemes. Moreover, electronic voting schemes is a class of systems that require very high assurance. The literature contains a number of ballot privacy definitions along with security proofs for common systems. Some machine-checked security proofs have also appeared. We define a new ballot privacy notion that captures a larger class of voting schemes. This notion improves on the state of the art by taking into account that verification in many schemes will happen or must happen after the tally has been published, not before as in previous definitions. As a case study we give a machine-checked proof of privacy for Selene, which is a remote electronic voting scheme which offers an attractive mix of security properties and usability. Prior to our work, the computational privacy of Selene has never been formally verified. Finally, we also prove that MiniVoting and Belenios satisfies our definition.
papers.abstract_zh: 众所周知，在复杂的系统中，尤其是在电子投票方案中，隐私是一个很难实现的特性。此外，电子投票方案是一类需要非常高的安全性的系统。该文献包含许多投票隐私定义以及常见系统的安全性证明。一些机器检查的安全证明也出现了。我们定义了一个新的投票隐私概念，它包含了一大类投票方案。这个概念通过考虑在许多方案中验证将发生或必须发生在计数被公布之后，而不是像先前的定义中那样在此之前，而改进了现有技术。作为一个案例研究，我们给出了塞勒涅的机器检查的隐私证明，这是一个远程电子投票方案，它提供了一个安全属性和可用性的诱人组合。在我们的工作之前，塞勒涅的计算隐私从未被正式验证过。最后，我们还证明了MiniVoting和Belenios满足我们的定义。
papers.title_zh: 塞勒涅公司针对恶意板的机器检查隐私证明

papers.title: Universal Optimality and Robust Utility Bounds for Metric Differential Privacy
papers.authors: Natasha Fernandes, Annabelle McIver, Catuscia Palamidessi, Ming Ding
papers.abstract: We study the privacy-utility trade-off in the context of metric differential privacy. Ghosh et al. introduced the idea of universal optimality to characterise the “best” mechanism for a certain query that simultaneously satisfies (a fixed) $\mathcal{E-}$ differential privacy constraint whilst at the same time providing better utility compared to any other s-differentially private mechanism for the same query. They showed that the Geometric mechanism is universally optimal for the class of counting queries. On the other hand, Brenner and Nissim showed that outside the space of counting queries, and for the Bayes risk loss function, no such universally optimal mechanisms exist. Except for universal optimality of the Laplace mechanism, there have been no generalisations of these universally optimal results to other classes of differentially-private mechanisms. In this paper we use metric differential privacy and quantitative information flow as the fundamental principle for studying universal optimality. Metric differential privacy is a generali-sation of both standard (i.e., central) differential privacy and local differential privacy, and it is increasingly being used in various application domains, for instance in location privacy and in privacy preserving machine learning. As do Ghosh et al. and Brenner and Nissim, we measure utility in terms of loss functions, and we interpret the notion of a privacy mechanism as an information-theoretic channel satisfying constraints defined by ε-differcntlal privacy and a metric meaningful to the underlying state space. Using this framework we are able to clarify Nissim and Brenner's negative results by (a) that in fact all privacy types contain optimal mechanisms relative to certain kinds of non-trivial loss functions, and (b) extending and generalising their negative results beyond Bayes risk specifically to a wide class of non-trivial loss functions. Our exploration suggests that universally optimal mechanisms are indeed rare within privacy types. We therefore propose weaker universal benchmarks of utility called privacy type ca-pacities. We show that such capacities always exist and can be computed using a convex optimisation algorithm. We illustrate these ideas on a selection of examples with several different underlying metrics.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们在度量差分隐私的背景下研究隐私-效用权衡。Ghosh等人引入了泛最优性的概念来描述某个查询的“最佳”机制的特征，该机制同时满足(固定的)$\mathcal{E-}$差分隐私约束，同时为相同的查询提供比任何其他差分隐私机制更好的效用。他们证明了几何机制对于计数查询类是普遍最优的。另一方面，Brenner和Nissim表明，在计数查询的空间之外，对于Bayes风险损失函数，不存在这种普遍最优的机制。除了拉普拉斯机制的普遍最优性之外，还没有将这些普遍最优的结果推广到其他类别的差分私有机制。在本文中，我们使用度量差分隐私和量化信息流作为研究泛最优性的基本原则。度量差分隐私是标准(即中央)差分隐私和局部差分隐私的一般化，并且它正越来越多地用于各种应用领域，例如位置隐私和隐私保护机器学习。正如Ghosh等人以及Brenner和Nissim所做的那样，我们根据损失函数来度量效用，并且我们将隐私机制的概念解释为满足由ε-differcntlal隐私定义的约束的信息论信道以及对底层状态空间有意义的度量。使用该框架，我们能够通过以下方式澄清Nissim和Brenner的负面结果:( a)事实上，所有隐私类型都包含相对于某些非平凡损失函数的最优机制,( b)将他们的负面结果从Bayes风险扩展和概括到一大类非平凡损失函数。我们的研究表明，普遍最优的机制在隐私类型中确实很少。因此，我们提出了称为隐私型容量的较弱的通用效用基准。我们证明了这样的容量总是存在的，并且可以使用凸优化算法来计算。我们用几个不同的底层度量标准来举例说明这些想法。
papers.title_zh: 度量差分隐私的泛最优性和鲁棒效用界

papers.title: Unlinkability of an Improved Key Agreement Protocol for EMV 2nd Gen Payments
papers.authors: Ross Horne, Sjouke Mauw, Semen Yurkov
papers.abstract: To address known privacy problems with the EMV standard, EMVCo have proposed a Blinded Diffie-Hellman key establishment protocol, which is intended to be part of a future 2nd Gen EMV protocol. We point out that active attackers were not previously accounted for in the privacy requirements of this proposal protocol, and demonstrate that an active attacker can compromise unlinkability within a distance of 100cm. Here, we adopt a strong definition of unlinkability that does account for active attackers and propose an enhancement of the protocol proposed by EMVCo. We prove that our protocol does satisfy strong unlinkability, while preserving authentication.
papers.abstract_zh: 为了解决EMV标准的已知隐私问题，EMVCo已经提出了盲Diffie-Hellman密钥建立协议，该协议旨在成为未来第二代EMV协议的一部分。我们指出，主动攻击者以前没有被考虑在这个建议协议的隐私要求中，并证明了主动攻击者可以在100厘米的距离内破坏不可链接性。这里，我们采用了一个强的不可链接性定义，它考虑了主动攻击者，并提出了一个由EMVCo提出的协议的增强。我们证明了我们的协议满足强不可链接性，同时保持认证。
papers.title_zh: EMV第二代支付改进密钥协商协议的不可链接性

papers.title: Adversarial Robustness Verification and Attack Synthesis in Stochastic Systems
papers.authors: Lisa Oakley, Alina Oprea, Stavros Tripakis
papers.abstract: Probabilistic model checking is a useful technique for specifying and verifying properties of stochastic systems including randomized protocols and reinforcement learning models. However, these methods rely on the assumed structure and probabilities of certain system transitions. These assumptions may be incorrect, and may even be violated by an adversary who gains control of some system components. In this paper, we develop a formal framework for adversarial robustness in systems modeled as discrete time Markov chains (DTMCs). We base our framework on existing methods for verifying probabilistic temporal logic properties and extend it to include deterministic, memoryless policies acting in Markov decision processes (MDPs). Our framework includes a flexible approach for specifying structure-preserving and non structure-preserving adversarial models. We outline a class of threat models under which adversaries can perturb system transitions, constrained by an $\varepsilon$ ball around the original transition probabilities. We define three main DTMC adversarial robustness problems: adversarial robustness verification, maximal $\delta$ synthesis, and worst case attack synthesis. We present two optimization-based solutions to these three problems, leveraging traditional and parametric probabilistic model checking techniques. We then evaluate our solutions on two stochastic protocols and a collection of Grid World case studies, which model an agent acting in an environment described as an MDP. We find that the parametric solution results in fast computation for small parameter spaces. In the case of less restrictive (stronger) adversaries, the number of parameters increases, and directly computing property satisfaction probabilities is more scalable. We demonstrate the usefulness of our definitions and solutions by comparing system outcomes over various properties, threat models, and case studies.
papers.abstract_zh: 概率模型检验是一种用于指定和验证随机系统(包括随机协议和强化学习模型)属性的有用技术。然而，这些方法依赖于假设的结构和某些系统转换的概率。这些假设可能是不正确的，甚至可能被获得某些系统组件控制权的对手违反。在本文中，我们开发了一个形式化的框架，为系统的对抗性鲁棒性建模为离散时间马尔可夫链(DTMCs)。我们的框架基于现有的验证概率时态逻辑属性的方法，并将其扩展到包括在马尔可夫决策过程(MDP)中起作用的确定性的、无记忆的策略。我们的框架包括一个灵活的方法来指定结构保持和非结构保持对抗模型。我们概述了一类威胁模型，在这些模型下，对手可以干扰系统转换，并受到原始转换概率周围的＄\ var epsilon＄球的约束。我们定义了三个主要的DTMC对抗性鲁棒性问题:对抗性鲁棒性验证、最大$\delta$综合和最坏情况攻击综合。我们针对这三个问题提出了两个基于优化的解决方案，利用了传统的和参数化的概率模型检测技术。然后，我们在两个随机协议和一组网格世界案例研究上评估了我们的解决方案，这些案例研究模拟了一个代理在被描述为MDP的环境中的行为。我们发现参数解导致小参数空间的快速计算。在限制较少(更强)的对手的情况下，参数的数量增加，并且直接计算财产满足概率更具可扩展性。我们通过比较各种属性、威胁模型和案例研究的系统结果来证明我们的定义和解决方案的有效性。
papers.title_zh: 随机系统中的对抗性鲁棒性验证和攻击合成

papers.title: The Complexity of Verifying Boolean Programs as Differentially Private
papers.authors: Mark Bun, Marco Gaboardi, Ludmila Glinskih
papers.abstract: We study the complexity of the problem of verifying differential privacy for while-like programs working over boolean values and making probabilistic choices. Programs in this class can be interpreted into finite-state discrete-time Markov Chains (DTMC). We show that the problem of deciding whether a program is differentially private for specific values of the privacy parameters is PSPACE-complete. To show that this problem is in PSPACE, we adapt classical results about computing hitting probabilities for DTMC. To show PSPACE-hardness we use a reduction from the problem of checking whether a program almost surely terminates or not. We also show that the problem of approximating the privacy parameters that a program provides is PSPACE-hard. Moreover, we investigate the complexity of similar problems also for several relaxations of differential privacy: Renyi differential privacy, concentrated differential privacy, and truncated concentrated differential privacy. For these notions, we consider gap-versions of the problem of deciding whether a program is private or not and we show that all of them are PSPACE-complete.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们研究了验证类while程序在布尔值上工作并进行概率选择的差分隐私问题的复杂性。这类程序可以解释为有限状态离散时间马尔可夫链(DTMC)。我们证明了决定一个程序对于隐私参数的特定值是否是差分私有的问题是PSPACE-完全的。为了说明这个问题是在PSPACE中，我们采用了关于计算DTMC命中概率的经典结果。为了显示PSPACE-hardness，我们使用了一个检查程序是否几乎肯定终止的问题的简化。我们还表明，近似程序提供的隐私参数的问题是PSPACE-hard。此外，我们还研究了几种不同的差分隐私的松弛情况下类似问题的复杂性:Renyi差分隐私、集中差分隐私和截断集中差分隐私。对于这些概念，我们考虑了决定一个程序是否是私有的问题的gap版本，并且我们证明了它们都是PSPACE完全的。
papers.title_zh: 验证布尔程序为差分私有程序的复杂性

papers.title: Adversary Safety by Construction in a Language of Cryptographic Protocols
papers.authors: Timothy M. Braje, Alice R. Lee, Andrew Wagner, Benjamin Kaiser, Daniel Park, Martine Kalke, Robert K. Cunningham, Adam Chlipala
papers.abstract: Compared to ordinary concurrent and distributed systems, cryptographic protocols are distinguished by the need to reason about interference by adversaries. We suggest a new layered approach to tame that complexity, via an executable protocol language whose semantics does not reveal an adversary directly, instead enforcing a set of intuitive hygiene rules. By virtue of those rules, protocols written in this language provably behave identically with or without interference by active Dolev-Yao-style adversaries. As a result, formal reasoning about protocols can be simplified enough that even naïve model checking can establish correctness of a multiparty protocol, through analysis of a state space with no adversary. We present the design and implementation of SPICY, short for Secure Protocols Implemented CorrectlY, including the semantics of its input languages; the essential safety proofs, formalized in the Coq theorem prover; and the automation techniques. We provide a preliminary evaluation of the tool's performance and capabilities via a handful of case studies.
papers.abstract_zh: 与普通的并发和分布式系统相比，密码协议的特点是需要推理对手的干扰。我们提出了一种新的分层方法来驯服这种复杂性，通过一种可执行的协议语言，其语义不会直接揭示对手，而是强制执行一组直观的卫生规则。凭借这些规则，用这种语言编写的协议可以证明，无论有没有活跃的Dolev-Yao式对手的干扰，其行为都是相同的。因此，关于协议的形式推理可以被足够简化，以至于即使是天真的模型检查也可以通过分析没有对手的状态空间来建立多方协议的正确性。我们介绍了spirit的设计和实现，它是正确实现的安全协议的缩写，包括其输入语言的语义；在Coq定理证明器中形式化的本质安全证明；和自动化技术。我们通过一些案例研究对该工具的性能和功能进行了初步评估。
papers.title_zh: 通过用密码协议的语言来构造对手安全

papers.title: Legendre PRF (Multiple) Key Attacks and the Power of Preprocessing
papers.authors: Alexander May, Floyd Zweydinger
papers.abstract: Due to its amazing speed and multiplicative properties the Legendre PRF recently finds widespread applications e.g. in Ethereum 2.0, multiparty computation and in the quantum-secure signature proposal LegRoast. However, its security is not yet extensively studied. The Legendre PRF computes for a key <tex>$k$</tex> on input <tex>$x$</tex> the Legendre symbol <tex>$L_{k}(x)=(\frac{x+k}{p})$</tex> in some finite field <tex>$\mathbb{F}_{p}$</tex>. As standard notion, PRF security is analysed by giving an attacker oracle access to <tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex>. Khovratovich's collision-based algorithm recovers <tex>$k$</tex> using <tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex> in time <tex>$\sqrt{p}$</tex> with constant memory. It is a major open problem whether this birthday-bound complexity can be beaten. We show a somewhat surprising wide-ranging analogy between the discrete logarithm problem and Legendre symbol computations. This analogy allows us to adapt various algorithmic ideas from the discrete logarithm setting. More precisely, we present a small memory multiple-key attack on <tex>$m$</tex> Legendre keys <tex>$k_{1}, \ldots, k_{m}$</tex> in time <tex>$\sqrt{mp}$</tex>, i.e. with amortized cost <tex>$\sqrt{p/m}$</tex> per key. This multiple-key attack might be of interest in the Ethereum context, since recovering many keys simultaneously maximizes an attacker's profit. Moreover, we show that the Legendre PRF admits precomputation attacks, where the precomputation depends on the public <tex>$p$</tex> only - and not on a key <tex>$k$</tex>. Namely, an attacker may compute e.g. in precomputation time <tex>$p^{\frac{2}{3}}$</tex> a hint of size <tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>. On receiving access to <tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex> in an online phase, the attacker then uses the hint to recover the desired key <tex>$k$</tex> in time only <tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>. Thus, the attacker's online complexity again beats the birthday-bound. In addition, our precomputation attack can also be combined with our multiple-key attack. We explicitly give various tradeoffs between precomputation and online phase. E.g. for attacking <tex>$m$</tex> keys one may spend time <tex>$mp^{\frac{2}{3}}$</tex> in the precomputation phase for constructing a hint of size <tex>$m^{2}p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>. In an online phase, one then finds all <tex>$m$</tex> keys in total time only <tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>. Precomputation attacks might again be interesting in the Ethereum 2.0 context, where keys are frequently changed such that a heavy key-independent precomputation pays off.
papers.abstract_zh: 由于其惊人的速度和乘法特性，Legendre PRF最近在例如以太坊2.0、多方计算和量子安全签名提案LegRoast中找到了广泛的应用。然而，它的安全性还没有被广泛研究。Legendre PRF计算某个有限域< tex>$\mathbb{F}_{p}$</tex >中的Legendre符号< tex > $ L _ { k }(x)=(\ frac { x+k } { p })$ </tex >上的键< tex>$k$</tex >。作为标准概念，通过给予攻击者对< tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex >的oracle访问权来分析PRF安全性。Khovratovich的基于冲突的算法使用< tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex >在时间< tex>$\sqrt{p}$</tex >上恢复< tex>$k$</tex >，内存保持不变。这种受生日限制的复杂性能否被克服，是一个重大的未决问题。我们展示了离散对数问题和勒让德符号计算之间令人惊讶的广泛相似性。这个类比允许我们从离散对数设置中调整各种算法思想。更准确地说，我们提出了对< tex>$m$</tex> Legendre密钥< tex>$k_{1}，\ldots，k_{m}$</tex >在时间< tex>$\sqrt{mp}$</tex >上的小存储器多密钥攻击，即每个密钥的分摊成本为< tex>$\sqrt{p/m}$</tex >。这种多密钥攻击在以太坊环境中可能很有趣，因为同时恢复许多密钥可以使攻击者的利润最大化。此外，我们证明Legendre PRF允许预计算攻击，其中预计算仅依赖于公共密钥，而不依赖于密钥。即，攻击者可以例如在预计算时间<tex>$p^{\frac{2}{3}}$</tex>中计算大小为<tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>.的提示在联机阶段接收到对< tex>$L_{k}(\cdot)$</tex >的访问时，攻击者然后使用提示在仅<tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>.时间内恢复所需的密钥< tex>$k$</tex >因此，攻击者的在线复杂性再次击败了生日限制。此外，我们的预计算攻击也可以与我们的多密钥攻击相结合。我们明确给出了预计算和在线阶段之间的各种折衷。例如，为了攻击< tex>$m$</tex >密钥，可以在预计算阶段花费时间<tex>$mp^{\frac{2}{3}}$</tex>来构建大小为<tex>$m^{2}p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>.的提示在一个在线阶段，一个人找到所有的< tex>$m$</tex >键，总共只有<tex>$p^{\frac{1}{3}}$</tex>.预计算攻击可能在Ethereum 2.0环境中再次引起人们的兴趣，在这种环境中，密钥被频繁地更改，因此大量的与密钥无关的预计算是值得的。
papers.title_zh: Legendre PRF(多重)密钥攻击和预处理的能力

papers.title: A Complete Characterization of Security for Linicrypt Block Cipher Modes
papers.authors: Tommy Hollenberg, Mike Rosulek, Lawrence Roy
papers.abstract: We give characterizations of IND$-CPA security for a large, natural class of encryption schemes. Specifically, we consider encryption algorithms that invoke a block cipher and otherwise perform linear operations (e.g., XOR and multiplication by fixed field elements) on intermediate values. This class of algorithms corresponds to the Linicrypt model of Carmer & Rosulek (Crypto 2016). Our characterization for this class of encryption schemes is sound but not complete. We then focus on a smaller subclass of block cipher modes, which iterate over the blocks of the plaintext, repeatedly applying the same Linicrypt program. For these Linicrypt block cipher modes, we are able to give a sound and complete characterization of IND$-CPA security. Our characterization is linear-algebraic in nature and is easy to check for a candidate mode. Interestingly, we prove that a Linicrypt block cipher mode is secure if and only if it is secure against adversaries who choose all-zeroes plaintexts.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们给出了一大类自然加密方案的IND$-CPA安全性的特征。具体而言，我们考虑调用分组密码并对中间值执行线性运算(例如，XOR和乘以固定字段元素)的加密算法。这类算法对应的是Carmer & Rosulek (Crypto 2016)的Linicrypt模型。我们对这类加密方案的描述是合理的，但并不完整。然后，我们将重点放在分组密码模式的一个更小的子类上，它迭代明文的块，重复应用相同的Linicrypt程序。对于这些Linicrypt分组密码模式，我们能够给出IND$-CPA安全性的可靠和完整的特征。我们的特征本质上是线性代数的，并且易于检查候选模式。有趣的是，我们证明了Linicrypt分组密码模式是安全的，当且仅当它对选择全零明文的对手是安全的。
papers.title_zh: Linicrypt分组密码模式安全性的完全刻画

papers.title: Locked Circuit Indistinguishability: A Notion of Security for Logic Locking
papers.authors: Mohamed El Massad, Nahid Juma, Jonathan Shahen, Mariana Raykova, Siddharth Garg, Mahesh Tripunitara
papers.abstract: We address logic locking, a mechanism for securing digital Integrated Circuits (ICs) from piracy by untrustworthy foundries. We discuss previous work and the state-of-the-art, and observe that, despite more than a decade of research that has gone into the topic (resulting in both powerful attacks and subsequent defenses), there is no consensus on what it means for a particular locking mechanism to be secure. This paper attempts to remedy this situation. Specifically, it formulates a definition of security for a logic locking mechanism based on indistinguishability and relates the definition to security from actual attackers in a precise and unambiguous manner. We then describe a mechanism that satisfies the definition, thereby achieving (provable) security from all prior attacks. The mechanism assumes the existence of both a puncturable pseudorandom function family and an indistinguishability obfuscator, two cryptographic primitives that exist under well-founded assumptions. The mechanism builds upon the Stripped-Functionality Logic Locking (SFLL) framework, a state-of-the-art family of locking mechanisms whose potential for ever achieving security is currently in question. Along the way, partly as motivation, we present additional results, such as a reason founded in average-case complexity for why benchmark circuits locked with a prior scheme are susceptible to the well-known SAT attack against such schemes, and why provably thwarting the SAT attack is insufficient as a meaningful notion of security for logic locking.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了逻辑锁定，这是一种保护数字集成电路(ic)免受不可信代工厂盗版的机制。我们讨论了以前的工作和最新技术，并观察到，尽管对该主题进行了十多年的研究(导致了强大的攻击和随后的防御)，但对于特定锁定机制的安全意味着什么，还没有达成共识。本文试图补救这种情况。具体来说，它基于不可区分性为逻辑锁定机制制定了安全定义，并以精确和明确的方式将该定义与来自实际攻击者的安全相关联。然后，我们描述了一种满足定义的机制，从而实现了(可证明的)抵御所有先前攻击的安全性。该机制假设存在可穿孔伪随机函数族和不可区分混淆器，这两个密码原语在有充分根据的假设下存在。该机制建立在剥离功能逻辑锁定(SFLL)框架的基础上，这是一个最先进的锁定机制家族，其实现安全性的潜力目前还存在疑问。一路上，部分作为动机，我们提出了额外的结果，例如在平均情况复杂性中发现的原因，即为什么用先前方案锁定的基准电路容易受到针对这种方案的众所周知的SAT攻击，以及为什么可证明的阻止SAT攻击不足以作为逻辑锁定的安全的有意义的概念。
papers.title_zh: 锁定电路的不可区分性:逻辑锁定的安全概念

papers.title: Prophecy Variables for Hyperproperty Verification
papers.authors: Raven Beutner, Bernd Finkbeiner
papers.abstract: Temporal logics for hyperproperties like HyperLTL use trace quantifiers to express properties that relate multiple system runs. In practice, the verification of such specifications is mostly limited to formulas without quantifier alternation, where verification can be reduced to checking a trace property over the self-composition of the system. Quantifier alternations like $\forall\pi.\exists\pi^{\prime}.\phi$, can either be solved by complementation or with an interpretation as a two-person game between a v-player, who incrementally constructs the trace, and an 3-player, who constructs. The game-based approach is significantly cheaper but incomplete because the 3-player does not know the future moves of the $\omega$-player. In this paper, we establish that the game-based approach can be made complete by adding (w-regular) temporal prophecies. Our proof is constructiphecies.
papers.abstract_zh: 用于超属性(如HyperLTL)的时态逻辑使用跟踪量词来表达与多个系统运行相关的属性。在实践中，这种规范的验证主要限于没有量词替换的公式，其中验证可以简化为检查系统自组成的跟踪属性。像$\forall\pi这样的量词替换。\exists\pi^{\prime}.\phi$,可以通过互补来解决，也可以解释为一个v-玩家和一个3-玩家之间的双人游戏，v-玩家递增地构建轨迹，3-玩家构建轨迹。基于游戏的方法要便宜得多，但是不完整，因为3人游戏者不知道$ \ omega $-游戏者的未来行动。在本文中，我们证明了基于博弈的方法可以通过添加(w-正则)时间预言来完善。我们的证据是建构主义。
papers.title_zh: 超属性验证的预测变量

papers.title: Mapping Synthesis for Hyperproperties
papers.authors: Tzu-Han Hsu, Borzoo Bonakdarpour, Eunsuk Kang, Stavros Tripakis
papers.abstract: In system design, high-level system models typically need to be mapped to an execution platform (e.g., hardware, environment, compiler, etc). The platform may naturally strengthen some constraints or weaken some others, but it is expected that the low-level implementation on the platform should preserve all the functional and extra-functional properties of the model, including the ones for information-flow security. It is, however, well known that simple notions of refinement do not preserve information-flow security properties. In this paper, we propose a novel automated mapping synthesis approach that preserves hyperproperties expressed in the temporal logic HyperLTL. The significance of our technique is that it can handle formulas with quantifier alternations, which is typically the source of difficulty in refinement for information-flow security policies. We reduce the mapping synthesis problem to HyperLTL model checking and leverage recent efforts in bounded model checking for hyperproperties. We demonstrate how mapping synthesis can be used in various applications, including enforcing non-interference and automating secrecy-preserving refinement mapping. We also evaluate our approach using the battleship game and password validation use cases.
papers.abstract_zh: 在系统设计中，高级系统模型通常需要映射到执行平台(例如，硬件、环境、编译器等)。平台可能会自然地加强一些约束或削弱一些约束，但是平台上的底层实现应该保留模型的所有功能和额外功能属性，包括信息流安全性的属性。然而，众所周知，简单的精化概念并不能保持信息流的安全属性。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的自动映射综合方法，该方法保持了用时序逻辑HyperLTL表示的超属性。我们的技术的意义在于，它可以处理带有量词替换的公式，这通常是细化信息流安全策略的困难来源。我们将映射合成问题简化为超LTL模型检查，并利用最近在超属性的有界模型检查方面的努力。我们展示了映射合成如何在各种应用中使用，包括实施无干扰和自动化保密细化映射。我们还使用战舰游戏和密码验证用例来评估我们的方法。
papers.title_zh: 超性质的映射综合

papers.title: Yes We can: Watermarking Machine Learning Models beyond Classification
papers.authors: Sofiane Lounici, Mohamed Njeh, Orhan Ermis, Melek Önen, Slim Trabelsi
papers.abstract: Since machine learning models have become a valuable asset for companies, watermarking techniques have been developed to protect the intellectual property of these models and prevent model theft. We observe that current watermarking frameworks solely target image classification tasks, neglecting a considerable part of machine learning techniques. In this paper, we propose to address this lack and study the watermarking process of various machine learning techniques such as machine translation, regression, binary image classification and reinforcement learning models. We adapt current definitions to each specific technique and we evaluate the main characteristics of the watermarking process, in particular the robustness of the models against a rational adversary. We show that watermarking models beyond classification is possible while preserving their overall performance. We further investigate various attacks and discuss the importance of the performance metric in the verification process and its impact on the success of the adversary.
papers.abstract_zh: 由于机器学习模型已经成为公司的宝贵资产，因此已经开发了水印技术来保护这些模型的知识产权并防止模型被盗。我们观察到，目前的水印框架只针对图像分类任务，忽略了相当一部分的机器学习技术。在本文中，我们提出解决这一不足，并研究各种机器学习技术的水印过程，如机器翻译，回归，二值图像分类和强化学习模型。我们使当前的定义适应每种特定的技术，并且我们评估水印过程的主要特征，特别是模型对抗理性对手的鲁棒性。我们表明，水印模型超越分类是可能的，同时保持其整体性能。我们进一步研究了各种攻击，并讨论了性能指标在验证过程中的重要性及其对对手成功的影响。
papers.title_zh: 是的，我们可以:超越分类的水印机器学习模型

papers.title: Formal Impact Metrics for Cyber-physical Attacks
papers.authors: Ruggero Lanotte, Massimo Merro, Andrei Munteanu, Simone Tini
papers.abstract: Cyber-Physical systems (CPSs) are exposed to cyber- physical attacks, i.e., security breaches in cyberspace that adversely affect the physical processes of the systems.We define two probabilistic metrics to estimate the physical impact of attacks targeting cyber-physical systems formalised in terms of a probabilistic hybrid extension of Hennessy and Regan’s Timed Process Language. Our impact metrics estimate the impact of cyber-physical attacks taking into account: (i) the severity of the inflicted damage in a given amount of time, and (ii) the probability that these attacks are actually accomplished, according to the dynamics of the system under attack. In doing so, we pay special attention to stealthy attacks, i. e., attacks that cannot be detected by intrusion detection systems. As further contribution, we show that, under precise conditions, our metrics allow us to estimate the impact of attacks targeting a complex CPS in a compositional way, i.e., in terms of the impact on its sub-systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络物理系统(CPSs)面临网络物理攻击，即网络空间的安全漏洞对系统的物理过程产生不利影响。我们定义了两个概率度量来估计针对网络物理系统的攻击的物理影响，这两个度量是根据Hennessy和Regan的时间过程语言的概率混合扩展来形式化的。我们的影响指标评估网络物理攻击的影响，考虑:(I)在给定时间内造成的损害的严重性，以及(ii)根据受攻击系统的动态，这些攻击实际完成的概率。在这样做的时候，我们特别注意隐蔽攻击，即入侵检测系统无法检测到的攻击。作为进一步的贡献，我们表明，在精确的条件下，我们的度量允许我们以组合的方式估计针对复杂CPS的攻击的影响，即，根据对其子系统的影响。
papers.title_zh: 网络物理攻击的正式影响指标

papers.title: KACHINA - Foundations of Private Smart Contracts
papers.authors: Thomas Kerber, Aggelos Kiayias, Markulf Kohlweiss
papers.abstract: Smart contracts present a uniform approach for deploying distributed computation and have become a popular means to develop security critical applications. A major barrier to adoption for many applications is the public nature of existing systems, such as Ethereum. Several systems satisfying various definitions of privacy and requiring various trust assumptions have been proposed; however, none achieved the universality and uniformity that Ethereum achieved for non-private contracts: One unified method to construct most contracts. We provide a unified security model for private smart contracts which is based on the Universal Composition (UC) model and propose a novel core protocol, KACHINA, for deploying privacy-preserving smart contracts, which encompasses previous systems. We demonstrate the KACHINA method of smart contract development, using it to construct a contract that implements privacy-preserving payments, along the lines of Zerocash, which is provably secure in the UC setting and facilitates concurrency.
papers.abstract_zh: 智能契约为部署分布式计算提供了一种统一的方法，并且已经成为开发安全关键应用程序的一种流行手段。许多应用程序采用的一个主要障碍是现有系统的公共性质，如以太坊。已经提出了几个满足各种隐私定义并要求各种信任假设的系统；然而，没有一个实现了以太坊为非私有契约实现的普遍性和统一性:一个构造大多数契约的统一方法。我们为私有智能合约提供了一个基于统一合成(UC)模型的统一安全模型，并提出了一个新的核心协议KACHINA，用于部署保护隐私的智能合约，它包含了以前的系统。我们展示了智能契约开发的KACHINA方法，使用它来构建一个实现隐私保护支付的契约，沿着Zerocash的路线，这在UC设置中被证明是安全的，并促进了并发性。
papers.title_zh: KACHINA -私有智能合同的基础

papers.title: Machine-Checking Unforgeability Proofs for Signature Schemes with Tight Reductions to the Computational Diffie-Hellman Problem
papers.authors: François Dupressoir, Sara Zain
papers.abstract: Digital signatures based on the Discrete Logarithm (DL) problem often suffer from long signature sizes, and reductions made loose by the use of Pointcheval and Stern’s Forking Lemma. At EUROCRYPT 2003, Goh and Jarecki provided the first forking-free proof of unforgeability for a DL-based signature scheme—rooting its security in the hardness of the Computational Diffie-Hellman problem in the random oracle model. In this paper, we present and discuss the first machine-checked proofs for DL-based signature schemes reducing tightly to CDH, produced using EasyCrypt. We craft our proofs around a shim which reduces the local proof effort, and helps us identify patterns that can be easily adapted to similar tightly-secure DL-based schemes.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于离散对数(DL)问题的数字签名通常具有长签名长度，并且由于使用Pointcheval和Stern的分叉引理而变得松散。在EUROCRYPT 2003上，Goh和Jarecki为一个基于DL的签名方案提供了第一个无分叉的不可伪造性证明——其安全性源于随机预言模型中计算性Diffie-Hellman问题的困难性。在本文中，我们提出并讨论了第一个用EasyCrypt产生的紧归属于CDH的基于DL的签名方案的机器检验证明。我们围绕着一个垫片来制作我们的证明，这个垫片减少了本地证明的工作量，并且帮助我们识别可以容易地适应类似的严格安全的基于DL的方案的模式。
papers.title_zh: 对计算Diffie-Hellman问题进行严格简化的签名方案的机器检验不可伪造性证明

papers.title: CapablePtrs: Securely Compiling Partial Programs Using the Pointers-as-Capabilities Principle
papers.authors: Akram El-Korashy, Stelios Tsampas, Marco Patrignani, Dominique Devriese, Deepak Garg, Frank Piessens
papers.abstract: Capability machines such as CHERI provide memory capabilities that can be used by compilers to provide security benefits for compiled code (e.g., memory safety). The existing C to CHERI compiler, for example, achieves memory safety by following a principle called “pointers as capabilities” (PAC). Informally, PAC says that a compiler should represent a source language pointer as a machine code capability. But the security properties of PAC compilers are not yet well understood. We show that memory safety is only one aspect, and that PAC compilers can provide significant additional security guarantees for partial programs: the compiler can provide security guarantees for a compilation unit, even if that compilation unit is later linked to attacker-provided machine code.As such, this paper is the first to study the security of PAC compilers for partial programs formally. We prove for a model of such a compiler that it is fully abstract. The proof uses a novel proof technique (dubbed TrICL, read trickle), which should be of broad interest because it reuses the whole-program compiler correctness relation for full abstraction, thus saving work. We also implement our scheme for C on CHERI, show that we can compile legacy C code with minimal changes, and show that the performance overhead of compiled code is roughly proportional to the number of cross-compilation-unit function calls.
papers.abstract_zh: 诸如CHERI之类的能力机器提供可被编译器用来为编译后的代码提供安全益处(例如，存储器安全)的存储器能力。例如，现有的C到CHERI编译器通过遵循被称为“指针即能力”(PAC)的原则来实现内存安全。非正式地说，PAC认为编译器应该将源语言指针表示为机器码能力。但是PAC编译器的安全属性还没有被很好地理解。我们表明，内存安全只是一个方面，打包编译器可以为部分程序提供重要的额外安全保证:编译器可以为编译单元提供安全保证，即使该编译单元后来链接到攻击者提供的机器码。因此，本文首次正式研究部分程序PAC编译器的安全性。我们证明了这种编译器的模型是完全抽象的。该证明使用了一种新颖的证明技术(称为TrICL，read trickle)，这应该会引起广泛的兴趣，因为它重用了整个程序编译器的正确性关系来进行完全抽象，从而节省了工作。我们还在CHERI上实现了我们的C方案，表明我们可以编译遗留的C代码，只需做很少的修改，并表明编译代码的性能开销大致与跨编译单元函数调用的数量成比例。
papers.title_zh: CapablePtrs:使用指针作为功能的原则安全地编译部分程序

papers.title: Computationally sound Bitcoin tokens
papers.authors: Massimo Bartoletti, Stefano Lande, Roberto Zunino
papers.abstract: We propose a secure and efficient implementation of fungible tokens on Bitcoin. Our technique is based on a small extension of the Bitcoin script language, which allows the spending conditions in a transaction to depend on the neighbour transactions. We show that our implementation is computationally sound: that is, adversaries can make tokens diverge from their ideal functionality only with negligible probability.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个安全有效的比特币可替换代币的实现方案。我们的技术基于比特币脚本语言的一个小扩展，它允许交易中的消费条件取决于邻居交易。我们证明了我们的实现在计算上是可靠的:也就是说，对手能够使令牌偏离其理想功能的概率可以忽略不计。
papers.title_zh: 计算可靠的比特币代币

papers.title: Statistical Model Checking for Hyperproperties
papers.authors: Yu Wang, Siddhartha Nalluri, Borzoo Bonakdarpour, Miroslav Pajic
papers.abstract: Hyperproperties have shown to be a powerful tool for expressing and reasoning about information-flow security policies. In this paper, we investigate the problem of statistical model checking (SMC) for hyperproperties. Unlike exhaustive model checking, SMC works based on drawing samples from the system at hand and evaluate the specification with statistical confidence. The main benefit of applying SMC over exhaustive techniques is its efficiency and scalability. To reason about probabilistic hyperproperties, we first propose the temporal logic HyperPCTL* that extends PCTL* and HyperPCTL. We show that HyperPCTL* can express important probabilistic information-flow security policies that cannot be expressed with HyperPCTL. Then, we introduce SMC algorithms for verifying HyperPCTL* formulas on discrete-time Markov chains, based on sequential probability ratio tests (SPRT) with a new notion of multidimensional indifference region. Our SMC algorithms can handle both non-nested and nested probability operators for any desired significance level. To show the effectiveness of our technique, we evaluate our SMC algorithms on four case studies focused on information security: timing side-channel vulnerability in encryption, probabilistic anonymity in dining cryptographers, probabilistic noninterference of parallel programs, and the performance of a randomized cache replacement policy that acts as a countermeasure against cache flush attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 超属性已经被证明是表达和推理信息流安全策略的强大工具。本文研究超性质的统计模型检验问题。与详尽的模型检查不同，SMC的工作基于从手边的系统中抽取样本，并以统计置信度评估规范。与穷举技术相比，应用SMC的主要好处是它的效率和可伸缩性。为了推理概率超属性，我们首先提出了扩展PCTL*和hyper CTL的时态逻辑HyperPCTL *。我们证明HyperPCTL *可以表达用hyperctl无法表达的重要的概率信息流安全策略。然后，我们介绍了验证离散时间马氏链上HyperPCTL *公式的SMC算法，该算法基于多维无差异区域的序列概率比检验(SPRT)。我们的SMC算法可以处理非嵌套和嵌套概率操作符，以达到任何期望的显著性水平。为了显示我们的技术的有效性，我们在四个专注于信息安全的案例研究中评估了我们的SMC算法:加密中的定时旁路漏洞、用餐密码器中的概率匿名、并行程序的概率不干扰以及作为对抗缓存刷新攻击的对策的随机缓存替换策略的性能。
papers.title_zh: 超属性的统计模型检验

papers.title: Efficient Constructions of Pairing Based Accumulators
papers.authors: Ioanna Karantaidou, Foteini Baldimtsi
papers.abstract: Cryptographic accumulators are a crucial building block for a variety of applications where you need to represent a set of elements in a compact format while still being able to provide proofs of (non)membership. In this work, we give a number of accumulator constructions for the bilinear pairing setting in the trapdoor-based scenario, where a trusted manager maintains the accumulator. Using modular accumulator techniques, we first present the first optimally efficient (in terms of communication cost) dynamic, positive accumulators in the pairing setting. Additionally, we present a novel modular approach to construct universal accumulators that avoid costly non-membership proofs. We instantiate our generic construction and present the first universal accumulator in the bilinear pairing setting, that achieves constant parameter size, constant cost for element additions/deletions and witness generation by the manager, constant witness updates by the users and constant (non)membership verification. We finally show how our proposed universal accumulator construction can give rise to efficient ZK accumulators with constant non-membership witness updates.
papers.abstract_zh: 加密累加器是各种应用程序的重要组成部分，在这些应用程序中，您需要以紧凑的格式表示一组元素，同时仍然能够提供(非)成员资格的证明。在这项工作中，我们给出了在基于陷门的场景中双线性对设置的累加器的一些构造，其中可信管理器维护累加器。使用模块化累加器技术，我们首先在配对设置中提出第一个最优有效(就通信成本而言)的动态正累加器。此外，我们提出了一种新颖的模块化方法来构造通用累加器，避免了昂贵的非成员证明。我们实例化了我们的通用构造，并给出了双线性配对设置中的第一个通用累加器，它实现了恒定的参数大小、恒定的管理器元素添加/删除和见证生成成本、恒定的用户见证更新以及恒定的(非)成员资格验证。最后，我们展示了我们提出的通用累加器构造如何能够产生具有恒定非成员见证更新的高效ZK累加器。
papers.title_zh: 基于配对的累加器的有效构造

papers.title: Efficient Algorithms for Quantitative Attack Tree Analysis
papers.authors: Carlos E. Budde, Mariëlle Stoelinga
papers.abstract: Numerous analysis methods for quantitative attack tree analysis have been proposed. These algorithms compute relevant security metrics, i.e. performance indicators that quantity how good the security of a system is, such as the most likely attack, the cheapest, or the most damaging one. This paper classifies attack trees in two dimensions: proper trees vs. directed acyclic graphs (i.e. with shared subtrees); and static vs. dynamic gates. For each class, we propose novel algorithms that work over a generic attribute domain, encompassing a large number of concrete security metrics defined on the attack tree semantics. We also analyse the computational complexity of our methods.
papers.abstract_zh: 已经提出了许多用于定量攻击树分析的分析方法。这些算法计算相关的安全指标，即量化系统安全性的性能指标，如最可能的攻击、最便宜的攻击或最具破坏性的攻击。本文从两个维度对攻击树进行分类:固有树与有向无环图(即具有共享子树)；静态和动态门。对于每一类，我们提出了新的算法，这些算法在一个通用的属性域上工作，包含了在攻击树语义上定义的大量具体的安全度量。我们还分析了我们的方法的计算复杂性。
papers.title_zh: 定量攻击树分析的有效算法

papers.title: Consistency for Functional Encryption
papers.authors: Christian Badertscher, Aggelos Kiayias, Markulf Kohlweiss, Hendrik Waldner
papers.abstract: In functional encryption (FE) a sender, Alice, encrypts plaintexts for which a receiver, Bob, can obtain functional evaluations, while Charlie is responsible for initializing the encryption keys and issuing the decryption keys. Standard notions of security for FE deal with a malicious Bob and guarantee the confidentiality of Alice’s messages despite the leakage that occurs due to the functional keys that are revealed to the adversary via various forms of indistinguishability experiments that correspond to IND-CPA, IND-CCA and simulation-based security.In this work we provide a complete and systematic investigation of Consistency, a natural security property for FE, that deals with attacks that can be mounted by Alice, Charlie or a collusion of the two against Bob. We develop three main types of consistency notions according to which set of parties is corrupted and investigate their relation to the standard security properties of FE. To validate our different consistency types, we extend the universally composable framework for FE by Matt and Maurer (CSF 2015) and we show that our consistency notions naturally complement FE security by proving how they imply (and are implied by) UC security depending on which set of parties is corrupted; in this way we demonstrate a complete characterization of consistency for FE. Finally, we provide explicit constructions that achieve consistency efficiently either directly via a construction based on MDDH for specific function classes of inner products over a modulo group or generically for all the consistency types via compilers using standard cryptographic tools.
papers.abstract_zh: 在函数加密(FE)中，发送者Alice对明文进行加密，接收者Bob可以获得函数评估，而Charlie负责初始化加密密钥并发布解密密钥。FE的标准安全概念处理恶意Bob，并保证Alice的消息的机密性，尽管由于通过对应于IND-CPA、IND-CCA和基于模拟的安全性的各种形式的不可区分性实验向对手揭示的功能键而发生泄漏。在这项工作中，我们提供了对一致性的完整和系统的研究，一致性是FE的一个天然的安全属性，它处理可能由Alice、Charlie或两者的勾结对Bob发起的攻击。我们发展了三种主要类型的一致性概念，根据哪一组当事人被破坏，并研究了它们与FE的标准安全属性的关系。为了验证我们不同的一致性类型，我们扩展了Matt和Maurer (CSF 2015)的FE的通用可组合框架，并且我们通过证明我们的一致性概念如何暗示(并且被暗示)UC安全性(取决于哪组当事人被破坏),来表明我们的一致性概念自然地补充了FE安全性；这样，我们证明了铁一致性的完整表征。最后，我们提供了显式的构造，这些构造或者直接通过基于MDDH的构造对模群上内积的特定函数类有效地实现一致性，或者通过使用标准密码工具的编译器对所有一致性类型有效地实现一致性。
papers.title_zh: 功能加密的一致性

papers.title: Verifying Hyperproperties With TLA
papers.authors: Leslie Lamport, Fred B. Schneider
papers.abstract: Hyperproperties generalize ordinary properties by expressing relations among multiple executions of a system. Self–composition has been used to reduce verifying that a system satisfies certain classes of Hyperproperties to verifying that a derived system satisfies an ordinary property. By describing systems and their properties in the temporal logic TLA, we use self–composition to handle a larger class of Hyperproperties that includes those we have seen that express security conditions. TLA tools are used to verify that high–level designs of industrial systems satisfy properties. Now, they can also verify that those systems satisfy these Hyperproperties. No prior knowledge of Hyperproperties or TLA is assumed.
papers.abstract_zh: 超属性通过表达系统的多个执行之间的关系来概括普通属性。自合成已经被用于将验证系统满足某些类的超属性简化为验证派生系统满足普通属性。通过在时序逻辑TLA中描述系统及其属性，我们使用自组合来处理更大类别的超属性，包括那些我们已经看到的表达安全条件的超属性。TLA工具用于验证工业系统的高层设计满足特性。现在，他们也可以验证那些系统满足这些超性质。不需要预先知道超性质或TLA。
papers.title_zh: 验证TLA的超属性

papers.title: DDUO: General-Purpose Dynamic Analysis for Differential Privacy
papers.authors: Chike Abuah, Alex Silence, David Darais, Joseph P. Near
papers.abstract: Differential privacy enables general statistical analysis of data with formal guarantees of privacy protection at the individual level. Tools that assist data analysts with utilizing differential privacy have frequently taken the form of programming languages and libraries. However, many existing programming languages designed for compositional verification of differential privacy impose significant burden on the programmer (in the form of complex type annotations). Supplementary library support for privacy analysis built on top of existing general-purpose languages has been more usable, but incapable of pervasive end-to-end enforcement of sensitivity analysis and privacy composition. We introduce DDuo, a dynamic analysis for enforcing differential privacy. DDuo is usable by non-experts: its analysis is automatic and it requires no additional type annotations. DDuo can be implemented as a library for existing programming languages; we present a reference implementation in Python which features moderate runtime overheads on realistic workloads. We include support for several data types, distance metrics and operations which are commonly used in modern machine learning programs. We also provide initial support for tracking the sensitivity of data transformations in popular Python libraries for data analysis. We formalize the novel core of the DDuo system and prove it sound for sensitivity analysis via a logical relation for metric preservation. We also illustrate DDuo's usability and flexibility through various case studies which implement state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms.
papers.abstract_zh: 差异隐私允许对数据进行一般的统计分析，并在个人层面提供隐私保护的正式保证。帮助数据分析师利用差异隐私的工具经常采用编程语言和库的形式。然而，许多为差分隐私的组合验证而设计的现有编程语言给程序员带来了很大的负担(以复杂类型注释的形式)。建立在现有通用语言之上的隐私分析补充库支持已经变得更加可用，但是不能进行普遍的端到端的敏感性分析和隐私合成。我们介绍了DDuo，一种用于实施差分隐私的动态分析。非专家也可以使用DDuo:它的分析是自动的，不需要额外的类型注释。DDuo可以实现为现有编程语言的库；我们给出了一个Python中的参考实现，它在实际工作负载上的运行时开销适中。我们包括对现代机器学习程序中常用的几种数据类型、距离度量和运算的支持。我们还为跟踪流行Python库中数据转换的敏感性提供了初始支持，以便进行数据分析。我们形式化了DDuo系统的新颖核心，并通过度量保持的逻辑关系证明它对于灵敏度分析是合理的。我们还通过实现最先进的机器学习算法的各种案例研究来说明DDuo的可用性和灵活性。
papers.title_zh: DDUO:差分隐私的通用动态分析

papers.title: Formal security analysis of MPC-in-the-head zero-knowledge protocols
papers.authors: Nikolaj Sidorenco, Sabine Oechsner, Bas Spitters
papers.abstract: Zero-knowledge proofs allow a prover to convince a verifier of the veracity of a statement without revealing any other information. An interesting class of zero-knowledge protocols are those following the MPC-in-the-head paradigm (Ishai et al., STOC ’07) which use secure multiparty computation (MPC) protocols as the basis. Efficient instances of this paradigm have emerged as an active research topic in the last years, starting with ZKBoo (Giacomelli et al., USENIX ’16). Zero-knowledge protocols are a vital building block in the design of privacy-preserving technologies as well as cryptographic primitives like digital signature schemes that provide post-quantum security. This work investigates the security of zero-knowledge protocols following the MPC-in-the-head paradigm. We provide the first machine-checked security proof of such a protocol on the example of ZKBoo. Our proofs are checked in the EasyCrypt proof assistant. To enable a modular security proof, we develop a new security notion for the MPC protocols used in MPC-in-the-head zero-knowledge protocols. This allows us to recast existing security proofs in a black-box fashion which we believe to be of independent interest.
papers.abstract_zh: 零知识证明允许证明者在不透露任何其他信息的情况下使验证者相信陈述的真实性。一类有趣的零知识协议是那些遵循头部MPC范式(Ishai等人，STOC '07)的协议，它们使用安全多方计算(MPC)协议作为基础。从ZKBoo(贾科姆利等人，USENIX '16)开始，这种范式的有效实例在过去几年中已经成为一个活跃的研究课题。零知识协议是隐私保护技术设计的重要组成部分，也是提供后量子安全的数字签名方案等密码原语。这项工作研究零知识协议的安全性以下的MPC在头部的范式。我们以ZKBoo为例，给出了这种协议的第一个机器检查的安全性证明。我们的校样在EasyCrypt校样助手中检查。为了实现模块化安全证明，我们为MPC协议开发了一种新的安全概念。这允许我们以一种我们认为是独立的兴趣的黑盒方式来重写现有的安全证明。
papers.title_zh: 头部MPC零知识协议的形式化安全性分析

papers.title: A Quantale of Information
papers.authors: Sebastian Hunt, David Sands
papers.abstract: Information flow properties are the semantic cornerstone of a wide range of program transformations, program analyses, and security properties. The variety of information that can be transmitted from inputs to outputs in a deterministic system can be captured by representing information as equivalence relations over the sets of possible values, using an equivalence relation on the input domain to model what may be learned, and an equivalence relation on the output to model what may be observed. The set of equivalence relations over a given set of values form a lattice, where the partial order models containment of information, and lattice join models the effect of combining information. This elegant and general structure is sometimes referred to as the lattice of information.In this paper we identify an abstraction of information flow which has not been studied previously, namely disjunctive dependency (depending on x or y, as distinct from depending on both x and y). We argue that this refines the space of semantic models for dependency in a way which is both interesting in its own right and which has applications in security settings of practical interest (in particular, where so-called “Chinese wall policies” are in effect).To model disjunctive dependency we introduce a nontrivial generalisation of the lattice of information in the form of a richer structure, built on sets of equivalence relations closed under a novel condition called tiling-closure. This structure forms a quantale - a lattice equipped with a tensor operation - in which lattice join corresponds to disjunctive combination of information, and tensor corresponds to conjunctive combination. Using this we generalise the definition of information flow properties, and show that the definition has the key properties needed to support compositional reasoning about programs.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息流属性是广泛的程序转换、程序分析和安全属性的语义基础。在确定性系统中可以从输入传输到输出的各种信息可以通过将信息表示为可能值集合上的等价关系来捕获，使用输入域上的等价关系来模拟可以学习到的内容，使用输出上的等价关系来模拟可以观察到的内容。给定的一组值上的等价关系的集合形成一个格，其中偏序对信息的包含进行建模，而格连接对组合信息的效果进行建模。这种优雅而普通的结构有时被称为信息格。在本文中，我们确定了一个信息流的抽象，这是以前没有研究过的，即析取依赖(依赖于x或y，不同于同时依赖于x和y)。我们认为，这在某种程度上细化了依赖关系的语义模型的空间，这本身就很有趣，而且在实际感兴趣的安全设置中也有应用(特别是在所谓的“中国墙策略”生效的情况下)。为了对析取依赖进行建模，我们以更丰富的结构的形式引入了信息格的非平凡概括，其建立在在称为平铺闭包的新条件下闭合的等价关系集上。这种结构形成了quantale -一种配备了张量运算的格-其中格连接对应于信息的析取组合，张量对应于合取组合。利用这一点，我们概括了信息流属性的定义，并表明该定义具有支持关于程序的组合推理所需的关键属性。
papers.title_zh: 大量的信息

papers.title: Fixing the Achilles Heel of E-Voting: The Bulletin Board
papers.authors: Lucca Hirschi, Lara Schmid, David A. Basin
papers.abstract: The results of electronic elections should be verifiable so that any cheating is detected. To support this, many protocols employ an electronic bulletin board (BB) for publishing data that can be read by participants and used for verifiability checks. We demonstrate that the BB is itself a security-critical component that has often been treated too casually in previous designs and analyses. In particular, we present novel attacks on the e-voting protocols Belenios, Civitas, and Helios that violate some of their central security claims under realistic system assumptions. These attacks were outside the scope of prior security analyses as their verifiability notions assume an idealized BB.To enable the analysis of protocols under realistic assumptions about the BB, we introduce a new verifiability definition applicable to arbitrary BBs. We identify a requirement, called final-agreement, and formally prove that it is sufficient and, in most cases, necessary to achieve verifiability. We then propose a BB protocol that satisfies final-agreement under weak, realistic trust assumptions and provide a machine-checked proof thereof. Our protocol can replace existing BBs, enabling verifiability under much weaker trust assumptions.
papers.abstract_zh: 电子选举的结果应该是可验证的，这样任何作弊行为都可以被发现。为了支持这一点，许多协议采用电子公告板(BB)来发布参与者可以阅读并用于可验证性检查的数据。我们证明了BB本身是一个安全关键组件，在以前的设计和分析中常常被过于随意地对待。特别地，我们提出了对电子投票协议Belenios、Civitas和Helios的新颖攻击，这些攻击违反了它们在现实系统假设下的一些核心安全声明。这些攻击超出了先前安全分析的范围，因为它们的可验证性概念假设了一个理想化的BB。为了能够在关于BB的现实假设下分析协议，我们引入了一个适用于任意BB的新的可验证性定义。我们确定一个需求，称为最终协议，并正式证明它是充分的，并且在大多数情况下，是实现可验证性的必要条件。然后，我们提出了一个BB协议，它在弱的、现实的信任假设下满足最终协议，并提供了机器检查的证明。我们的协议可以取代现有的BBs，在更弱的信任假设下实现可验证性。
papers.title_zh: 修正电子投票的致命弱点:电子公告板

papers.title: Abstract Modeling of System Communication in Constructive Cryptography using CryptHOL
papers.authors: David A. Basin, Andreas Lochbihler, Ueli Maurer, S. Reza Sefidgar
papers.abstract: Proofs in simulation-based frameworks have the greatest rigor when they are machine checked. But the level of details in these proofs surpasses what the formal-methods community can handle with existing tools. Existing formal results consider streamlined versions of simulation-based frameworks to cope with this complexity. Hence, a central question is how to abstract details from composability results and enable their formal verification.In this paper, we focus on the modeling of system communication in composable security statements. Existing formal models consider fixed communication patterns to reduce the complexity of their proofs. However, as we will show, this can affect the reusability of security statements. We propose an abstract approach to modeling system communication in Constructive Cryptography that avoids this problem. Our approach is suitable for mechanized verification and we use CryptHOL, a framework for developing mechanized cryptography proofs, to implement it in the Isabelle/HOL theorem prover. As a case study, we formalize the construction of a secure channel using Diffie-Hellman key exchange and a one-time-pad.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于模拟的框架中的证明在被机器检查时是最严格的。但是这些证明的详细程度超过了形式方法团体可以用现有工具处理的程度。现有的正式结果考虑基于模拟的框架的简化版本来应对这种复杂性。因此，一个中心问题是如何从可组合性结果中抽象出细节，并使它们能够被形式化验证。在本文中，我们主要研究可组合安全语句中系统通信的建模。现有的形式化模型考虑固定的通信模式，以降低其证明的复杂性。然而，正如我们将要展示的，这会影响安全语句的可重用性。我们提出了一个抽象的方法来模拟系统通信的构造密码，避免了这个问题。我们的方法适用于机械化验证，我们使用CryptHOL，一个开发机械化密码证明的框架，在伊莎贝尔/HOL定理证明器中实现它。作为一个案例研究，我们使用Diffie-Hellman密钥交换和一次性密码本形式化地构造了一个安全通道。
papers.title_zh: 基于密码体制的构造密码系统通信抽象建模

papers.title: Mechanised Models and Proofs for Distance-Bounding
papers.authors: Ioana Boureanu, Constantin Catalin Dragan, François Dupressoir, David Gérault, Pascal Lafourcade
papers.abstract: In relay attacks, a man-in-the-middle adversary impersonates a legitimate party and makes it this party appear to be of an authenticator, when in fact they are not. In order to counteract relay attacks, distance-bounding protocols provide a means for a verifier (e.g., an payment terminal) to estimate his relative distance to a prover (e.g., a bankcard). We propose FlexiDB, a new cryptographic model for distance bounding, parameterised by different types of fine-grained corruptions. FlexiDB allows to consider classical cases but also new, generalised corruption settings. In these settings, we exhibit new attack strategies on existing protocols. Finally, we propose a proof-of-concept mechanisation of FlexiDB in the interactive cryptographic prover EasyCrypt. We use this to exhibit a flavour of man-in-the-middle security on a variant of MasterCard’s contactless-payment protocol.
papers.abstract_zh: 在中继攻击中，一个中间人对手扮演一个合法方，使其看起来是一个认证方，而实际上他们不是。为了对抗中继攻击，距离限制协议为验证者(例如，支付终端)提供了一种手段来估计他与证明者(例如，银行卡)的相对距离。我们提出了FlexiDB，一种新的距离边界加密模型，通过不同类型的细粒度破坏进行参数化。FlexiDB允许考虑经典案例，也允许考虑新的、普遍的腐败情况。在这种情况下，我们展示了对现有协议的新的攻击策略。最后，我们在交互式密码证明者EasyCrypt中提出了FlexiDB的概念验证机制。我们利用这一点来展示万事达卡非接触式支付协议的变体的中间人安全性。
papers.title_zh: 距离限制的机械化模型和证明

papers.title: Concavity, Core-concavity, Quasiconcavity: A Generalizing Framework for Entropy Measures
papers.authors: Arthur Américo, Pasquale Malacaria
papers.abstract: We present a new generalising framework for conditional entropies, considering a limit construction over sequences of core-concave entropies, and prove that quasiconcave functions are the set of such limits. This generalising framework subsumes recently proposed frameworks for entropies in quantitative information flow, including entropies whose conditional form reflects the expected leakage and the leakage in the worst-case scenario. Thanks to the properties of the limits it is also shown that several important information theoretical properties can be proven for the generalised entropies satisfying the axioms.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们给出了条件熵的一个新的推广框架，考虑了核凹熵序列上的一个极限结构，并证明了拟凹函数是这种极限的集合。这个概括框架包含了最近提出的定量信息流熵框架，包括其条件形式反映预期泄漏和最坏情况下泄漏的熵。由于极限的性质，还表明对于满足公理的广义熵，可以证明几个重要的信息理论性质。
papers.title_zh: 凹性、核心凹性、拟凹性:熵测度的推广框架

papers.title: Towards Language-Based Mitigation of Traffic Analysis Attacks
papers.authors: Jeppe Fredsgaard Blaabjerg, Aslan Askarov
papers.abstract: Traffic analysis attacks pose a major risk for online security. Distinctive patterns in communication act as fingerprints, enabling adversaries to de-anonymise communicating parties or to infer sensitive information. Despite the attacks being known for decades, practical solution are scarce. Network layer countermeasures have relied on black box padding schemes that require significant overheads in latency and bandwidth to mitigate the attacks, without fundamentally preventing them, and the problem has received little attention in the language-based information flow literature. Language-based methods provide a strong foundation for fundamentally addressing security issues, but previous work has overwhelmingly assumed that interactive programs communicate over secure channels, where messages are undetectable by unprivileged adversaries. This assumption is too strong for online communication where packets can be trivially observed by eavesdropping. In this paper we introduce SELENE, a small language for principled, provably secure communication over channels where packets are publicly observable, and we demonstrate how our program level defence can reduce the latency and bandwidth overheads induced compared with program-agnostic defence mechanisms. We believe that our results constitute a step towards practical, secure online communication.
papers.abstract_zh: 流量分析攻击给在线安全带来了重大风险。通信中的独特模式就像指纹一样，使对手能够对通信方进行解密或推断出敏感信息。尽管这些攻击已经为人所知几十年了，但实用的解决方案却很少。网络层对策依赖于黑盒填充方案，该方案需要延迟和带宽方面的大量开销来减轻攻击，而没有从根本上防止攻击，并且该问题在基于语言的信息流文献中很少受到关注。基于语言的方法为从根本上解决安全问题提供了一个强大的基础，但以前的工作绝大多数都假设交互式程序通过安全通道进行通信，其中的消息不能被无特权的对手检测到。这个假设对于在线通信来说太强了，在在线通信中，数据包可以被窃听到。在本文中，我们介绍了SELENE，这是一种小型语言，用于在分组可被公开观察的信道上进行有原则的、可证明安全的通信，并且我们展示了与程序不可知的防御机制相比，我们的程序级防御如何能够减少延迟和带宽开销。我们相信，我们的研究成果向实用、安全的在线交流迈进了一步。
papers.title_zh: 面向基于语言的流量分析攻击缓解

papers.title: Heuristic Approach for Countermeasure Selection Using Attack Graphs
papers.authors: Orly Stan, Ron Bitton, Michal Ezrets, Moran Dadon, Masaki Inokuchi, Yoshinobu Ohta, Tomohiko Yagyu, Yuval Elovici, Asaf Shabtai
papers.abstract: Selecting the optimal set of countermeasures to secure a network is a challenging task, since it involves various considerations and trade-offs, such as prioritizing the risks to mitigate given the mitigation costs. Previously suggested approaches are based on limited and largely manual risk assessment procedures, provide recommendations for a specific event, or don’t consider the organization’s constraints (e.g., limited budget). In this paper, we present an improved attack graph-based risk assessment process and apply heuristic search to select an optimal countermeasure plan for a given network and budget. The risk assessment process represents the risk in the system in such a way that incorporates the quantitative risk factors and relevant countermeasures; this allows us to assess the risk in the system under different countermeasure plans during the search, without the need to regenerate the attack graph. We also provide a detailed description of countermeasure modeling and discuss how the countermeasures can be automatically matched to the security issues discovered in the network.
papers.abstract_zh: 选择保护网络安全的最佳对策集是一项具有挑战性的任务，因为它涉及各种考虑和权衡，例如在给定缓解成本的情况下确定要缓解的风险的优先级。以前建议的方法是基于有限的且主要是手动的风险评估过程，为特定事件提供建议，或者不考虑组织的约束(例如，有限的预算)。在本文中，我们提出了一种改进的基于攻击图的风险评估过程，并应用启发式搜索来为给定的网络和预算选择最佳对策计划。风险评估过程以包含量化风险因素和相关对策的方式表示系统中的风险；这使我们能够在搜索过程中评估不同对策计划下的系统风险，而无需重新生成攻击图。我们还提供了对策建模的详细描述，并讨论了对策如何自动匹配网络中发现的安全问题。
papers.title_zh: 利用攻击图进行对策选择的启发式方法

papers.title: Performing Security Proofs of Stateful Protocols
papers.authors: Andreas V. Hess, Sebastian Mödersheim, Achim D. Brucker, Anders Schlichtkrull
papers.abstract: In protocol verification we observe a wide spectrum from fully automated methods to interactive theorem proving with proof assistants like Isabelle/HOL. The latter provide overwhelmingly high assurance of the correctness, which automated methods often cannot: due to their complexity, bugs in such automated verification tools are likely and thus the risk of erroneously verifying a flawed protocol is non-negligible. There are a few works that try to combine advantages from both ends of the spectrum: a high degree of automation and assurance. We present here a first step towards achieving this for a more challenging class of protocols, namely those that work with a mutable long-term state. To our knowledge this is the first approach that achieves fully automated verification of stateful protocols in an LCF-style theorem prover. The approach also includes a simple user-friendly transaction-based protocol specification language embedded into Isabelle, and can also leverage a number of existing results such as soundness of a typed model
papers.abstract_zh: 在协议验证中，我们观察到了从全自动方法到使用伊莎贝尔/HOL这样的证明助手进行交互式定理证明的广泛范围。后者提供了自动化方法通常不能提供的极高的正确性保证:由于其复杂性，这种自动化验证工具中的错误是可能的，因此错误地验证有缺陷的协议的风险是不可忽略的。有一些作品试图结合两方面的优势:高度的自动化和保证。我们在这里为更具挑战性的一类协议，即那些与可变长期状态一起工作的协议，提出了实现这一目标的第一步。据我们所知，这是第一个在LCF风格的定理证明器中实现全自动验证有状态协议的方法。该方法还包括嵌入到Isabelle中的简单的用户友好的基于事务的协议规范语言，并且还可以利用许多现有的结果，例如类型化模型的可靠性
papers.title_zh: 执行有状态协议的安全证明

papers.title: Backwards-directed information flow analysis for concurrent programs
papers.authors: Kirsten Winter, Nicholas Coughlin, Graeme Smith
papers.abstract: A number of approaches have been developed for analysing information flow in concurrent programs in a compositional manner, i.e., in terms of one thread at a time. Early approaches modelled the behaviour of a given thread’s environment using simple read and write permissions on variables, or by associating specific behaviour with whether or not locks are held. Recent approaches allow more general representations of environmental behaviour, increasing applicability. This, however, comes at a cost. These approaches analyse the code in a forwards direction, from the start of the program to the end, constructing the program’s entire state after each instruction. This process needs to take into account the environmental influence on all shared variables of the program. When environmental influence is modelled in a general way, this leads to increased complexity, hindering automation of the analysis. In this paper, we present a compositional information flow analysis for concurrent systems which is the first to support a general representation of environmental behaviour and be automated within a theorem prover. Our approach analyses the code in a backwards direction, from the end of the program to the start. Rather than constructing the entire state at each instruction, it generates only the security-related proof obligations. These are, in general, much simpler, referring to only a fraction of the program’s shared variables and thus reducing the complexity introduced by environmental behaviour. For increased applicability, our approach analyses value-dependent information flow, where the security classification of a variable may depend on the current state. The resulting logic has been proved sound within the theorem prover Isabelle/HOL.
papers.abstract_zh: 已经开发了许多方法来以组合的方式分析并发程序中的信息流，即，一次一个线程。早期的方法使用对变量的简单读写权限，或者通过将特定行为与是否持有锁相关联，来模拟给定线程环境的行为。最近的方法允许更一般的环境行为表现，增加了适用性。然而，这是有代价的。这些方法向前分析代码，从程序的开始到结束，在每个指令后构建程序的整个状态。这个过程需要考虑环境对程序所有共享变量的影响。当环境影响以一般方式建模时，这导致复杂性增加，阻碍了分析的自动化。在本文中，我们提出了一个并发系统的组合信息流分析，它是第一个支持环境行为的一般表示，并在一个定理证明器中实现自动化。我们的方法向后分析代码，从程序的结尾到开始。它不是在每条指令中构造整个状态，而是只生成与安全相关的证明义务。总的来说，这要简单得多，只涉及程序共享变量的一小部分，因此降低了环境行为带来的复杂性。为了增加适用性，我们的方法分析依赖于值的信息流，其中变量的安全分类可能依赖于当前状态。由此产生的逻辑在定理证明者伊莎贝尔/HOL那里被证明是合理的。
papers.title_zh: 并发程序的逆向信息流分析

papers.title: On Compositional Information Flow Aware Refinement
papers.authors: Christoph Baumann, Mads Dam, Roberto Guanciale, Hamed Nemati
papers.abstract: The concepts of information flow security and refinement are known to have had a troubled relationship ever since the seminal work of McLean. In this work we study refinements that support changes in data representation and semantics, including the addition of state variables that may induce new observational power or side channels. We propose a new epistemic approach to ignorance-preserving refinement where an abstract model is used as a specification of a system’s permitted information flows, that may include the declassification of secret information. The core idea is to require that refinement steps must not induce observer knowledge that is not already available in the abstract model. Our study is set in the context of a class of shared variable multiagent models similar to interpreted systems in epistemic logic. We demonstrate the expressiveness of our framework through a series of small examples and compare our approach to existing, stricter notions of information-flow secure refinement based on bisimulations and noninterference preservation. Interestingly, noninterference preservation is not supported “out of the box” in our setting, because refinement steps may introduce new secrets that are independent of secrets already present at abstract level. To support verification, we first introduce a “cube-shaped” unwinding condition related to conditions recently studied in the context of value-dependent noninterference, kernel verification, and secure compilation. A fundamental problem with ignorance-preserving refinement, caused by the support for general data and observation refinement, is that sequential composability is lost. We propose a solution based on relational pre-and postconditions and illustrate its use together with unwinding on the oblivious RAM construction of Chung and Pass.
papers.abstract_zh: 众所周知，自从McLean的开创性工作以来，信息流安全性和精化的概念就有着一种麻烦的关系。在这项工作中，我们研究了支持数据表示和语义变化的改进，包括增加可能导致新的观察能力或侧通道的状态变量。我们提出了一种新的认知方法来保持无知的精炼，其中抽象模型被用作系统允许信息流的规范，这可能包括秘密信息的解密。核心思想是要求精化步骤不能诱导抽象模型中不存在的观察者知识。我们的研究背景是一类共享变量多主体模型，类似于认知逻辑中的解释系统。我们通过一系列小例子展示了我们的框架的表达能力，并将我们的方法与现有的、更严格的基于互模拟和无干扰保护的信息流安全精化概念进行了比较。有趣的是，在我们的设置中，不支持“开箱即用”的无干扰保存，因为精化步骤可能会引入新的秘密，这些秘密独立于已经在抽象级别存在的秘密。为了支持验证，我们首先引入一个“立方体”展开条件，该条件与最近在值相关的不干扰、内核验证和安全编译的上下文中研究的条件相关。由对一般数据和观察精化的支持引起的无知保持精化的一个基本问题是顺序可组合性丢失了。我们提出了一个基于关系前置和后置条件的解决方案，并结合Chung和Pass的不经意RAM结构的展开来说明它的使用。
papers.title_zh: 组合信息流感知精化研究

papers.title: Gradual Security Types and Gradual Guarantees
papers.authors: Abhishek Bichhawat, McKenna McCall, Limin Jia
papers.abstract: Information flow type systems enforce the security property of noninterference by detecting unauthorized data flows at compile-time. However, they require precise type annotations, making them difficult to use in practice as much of the legacy infrastructure is written in untyped or dynamically-typed languages. Gradual typing seamlessly integrates static and dynamic typing, providing the best of both approaches, and has been applied to information flow control, where information flow monitors are derived from gradual security types. Prior work on gradual information flow typing uncovered tensions between noninterference and the dynamic gradual guarantee— the property that less precise security type annotations in a program should not cause more runtime errors.This paper re-examines the connection between gradual information flow types and information flow monitors to identify the root cause of the tension between the gradual guarantees and noninterference. We develop runtime semantics for a simple imperative language with gradual information flow types that provides both noninterference and gradual guarantees. We leverage a proof technique developed for FlowML and reduce noninterference proofs to preservation proofs.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息流类型系统通过在编译时检测未授权的数据流来加强不干扰的安全属性。然而，它们需要精确的类型注释，这使得它们在实践中很难使用，因为许多遗留基础设施是用无类型或动态类型的语言编写的。渐进类型化无缝地集成了静态和动态类型化，提供了这两种方法的优点，并已被应用于信息流控制，其中信息流监视器是从渐进安全类型派生出来的。先前关于渐进信息流类型化的工作揭示了不干涉和动态渐进保证之间的紧张关系——程序中不太精确的安全类型注释不应导致更多运行时错误的属性。本文重新考察了渐进信息流类型和信息流监视器之间的联系，以确定渐进保证和不干涉之间紧张关系的根本原因。我们为一种简单的命令式语言开发了运行时语义，这种语言具有渐进的信息流类型，提供了不干涉和渐进的保证。我们利用为FlowML开发的证明技术，将无干扰证明简化为保存证明。
papers.title_zh: 渐进式担保类型和渐进式担保

papers.title: Relational Analysis of Sensor Attacks on Cyber-Physical Systems
papers.authors: Jian Xiang, Nathan Fulton, Stephen Chong
papers.abstract: Cyber-physical systems, such as self-driving cars or autonomous aircraft, must defend against attacks that target sensor hardware. Analyzing system design can help engineers understand how a compromised sensor could impact the system’s behavior; however, designing security analyses for cyber-physical systems is difficult due to their combination of discrete dynamics, continuous dynamics, and nondeterminism.This paper contributes a framework for modeling and analyzing sensor attacks on cyber-physical systems, using the formalism of hybrid programs. We formalize and analyze two relational properties of a system’s robustness. These relational properties respectively express (1) whether a system’s safety property can be influenced by sensor attacks, and (2) whether a system’s high-integrity state can be affected by sensor attacks. We characterize these relational properties by defining an equivalence relation between a system under attack and the original unattacked system. That is, the system satisfies the robustness properties if executions of the attacked system are appropriately related to executions of the unattacked system.We present two techniques for reasoning about the equivalence relation and thus proving the relational properties for a system. One proof technique decomposes large proof obligations to smaller proof obligations. The other proof technique adapts the self-composition technique from the literature on secure information-flow, allowing us to reduce reasoning about the equivalence of two systems to reasoning about properties of a single system. This technique allows us to reuse existing tools for reasoning about properties of hybrid programs, but is challenging due to the combination of discrete dynamics, continuous dynamics, and nondeterminism.To validate the usefulness of our relational properties and proof techniques, we present three case studies motivated by real design flaws in existing cyber-physical systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络物理系统，如自动驾驶汽车或自动驾驶飞机，必须抵御针对传感器硬件的攻击。分析系统设计可以帮助工程师理解受损的传感器如何影响系统的行为；然而，为信息物理系统设计安全分析是困难的，因为它们结合了离散动态、连续动态和不确定性。本文提供了一个框架，用于建模和分析传感器对信息物理系统的攻击，使用混合程序的形式。我们形式化并分析了系统健壮性的两个相关属性。这些关系属性分别表示(1)系统的安全属性是否会受到传感器攻击的影响，以及(2)系统的高完整性状态是否会受到传感器攻击的影响。我们通过定义受攻击系统和原始未受攻击系统之间的等价关系来表征这些关系属性。也就是说，如果被攻击系统的执行与未被攻击系统的执行适当相关，则系统满足鲁棒性。我们提出了两种关于等价关系的推理技术，从而证明了系统的关系属性。一种证明技术将大的证明义务分解成较小的证明义务。另一种证明技术采用了安全信息流文献中的自组合技术，允许我们将对两个系统的等价性的推理简化为对单个系统的属性的推理。这种技术允许我们重用现有的工具来推理混合程序的属性，但是由于离散动态、连续动态和不确定性的组合，这是具有挑战性的。为了验证我们的关系属性和证明技术的有效性，我们提出了三个由现有信息物理系统中的真实设计缺陷激发的案例研究。
papers.title_zh: 信息物理系统中传感器攻击的关联分析

papers.title: Accountability in the Decentralised-Adversary Setting
papers.authors: Robert Künnemann, Deepak Garg, Michael Backes
papers.abstract: A promising paradigm in protocol design is to hold parties accountable for misbehavior, instead of postulating that they are trustworthy. Recent approaches in defining this property, called accountability, characterized malicious behavior as a deviation from the protocol that causes a violation of the desired security property, but did so under the assumption that all deviating parties are controlled by a single, centralized adversary. In this work, we investigate the setting where multiple parties can deviate with or without coordination in a variant of the applied-$\pi$ calculus.We first demonstrate that, under realistic assumptions, it is impossible to determine all misbehaving parties; however, we show that accountability can be relaxed to exclude causal dependencies that arise from the behavior of deviating parties, and not from the protocol as specified. We map out the design space for the relaxation, point out protocol classes separating these notions and define conditions under which we can guarantee fairness and completeness. Most importantly, we discover under which circumstances it is correct to consider accountability in the single-adversary setting, where this property can be verified with off-the-shelf protocol verification tools.
papers.abstract_zh: 协议设计中一个有希望的范例是让各方对不当行为负责，而不是假设他们是值得信任的。最近定义这种属性的方法，称为责任，将恶意行为描述为对协议的偏离，导致对期望的安全属性的违反，但是这样做是基于这样的假设，即所有偏离方由单个集中的对手控制。在这项工作中，我们研究了多方可以在有或没有协调的情况下偏离应用-$\pi$演算的变体的设置。我们首先证明，在现实的假设下，不可能确定所有行为不端的当事人；然而，我们表明，问责制可以放宽，以排除因偏离方的行为而产生的因果依赖，而不是指定的协议。我们为放松设计了设计空间，指出了分隔这些概念的协议类，并定义了我们可以保证公平性和完整性的条件。最重要的是，我们发现在什么情况下考虑单一对手环境中的可追究性是正确的，在这种情况下，该属性可以用现成的协议验证工具来验证。
papers.title_zh: 分权对抗环境下的问责制

papers.title: Verified Multiple-Time Signature Scheme from One-Time Signatures and Timestamping
papers.authors: Denis Firsov, Henri Lakk, Ahto Truu
papers.abstract: Buldas, Laanoja, and Truu designed a family of server-assisted digital signature schemes (BLT signatures) built around cryptographic timestamping and forward-resistant tag systems. The original constructions had either expensive key generation phase or stateful client-side computations. In this paper, we construct a stateless tag system with efficient key generation from one-time signature schemes. We prove that the proposed tag system is forward-resistant and when combined with cryptographic timestamping, it induces a secure (existentially unforgeable) multiple-time signature scheme. Our constructions are developed and verified using the EasyCrypt framework.
papers.abstract_zh: Buldas、Laanoja和Truu设计了一系列服务器辅助数字签名方案(BLT签名),这些方案是围绕加密时间戳和抗转发标签系统构建的。最初的构造要么有昂贵的密钥生成阶段，要么有状态的客户端计算。在本文中，我们利用一次性签名方案构造了一个高效密钥生成的无状态标签系统。我们证明了所提出的标签系统是抗前向攻击的，并且当与密码时间戳结合时，它诱导了一个安全的(存在不可伪造的)多次签名方案。我们的构造是使用EasyCrypt框架开发和验证的。
papers.title_zh: 从一次签名和时间戳验证多次签名方案

papers.title: Resource-Aware Session Types for Digital Contracts
papers.authors: Ankush Das, Stephanie Balzer, Jan Hoffmann, Frank Pfenning, Ishani Santurkar
papers.abstract: Programming digital contracts comes with unique challenges, which include (i) expressing and enforcing protocols of interaction, (ii) controlling resource usage, and (iii) preventing the duplication or deletion of a contract’s assets. This article presents the design and type-theoretic foundation of Nomos, a programming language for digital contracts that addresses these challenges. To express and enforce protocols, Nomos is based on shared binary session types. To control resource usage, Nomos employs automatic amortized resource analysis. To prevent the duplication or deletion of assets, Nomos uses a linear type system. A monad integrates the effectful session-typed language with a general-purpose functional language. Nomos’ prototype implementation features linear-time type checking and efficient type reconstruction that includes automatic inference of resource bounds via off-the-shelf linear optimization. The effectiveness of the language is evaluated with case studies on implementing common smart contracts such as auctions, elections, and currencies. Nomos is completely formalized, including the type system, a cost semantics, and a transactional semantics to deploy Nomos contracts on a blockchain. The type soundness proof ensures that protocols are followed at run-time and that types establish sound upper bounds on the resource consumption, ruling out re-entrancy and out-of-gas vulnerabilities.
papers.abstract_zh: 数字合同的编程面临独特的挑战，包括(I)表达和执行交互协议，(ii)控制资源使用，以及(iii)防止合同资产的复制或删除。本文介绍了Nomos的设计和类型理论基础，这是一种用于数字契约的编程语言，可以解决这些挑战。为了表达和执行协议，Nomos基于共享的二进制会话类型。为了控制资源使用，Nomos采用了自动摊余资源分析。为了防止重复或删除资产，Nomos使用了线性类型系统。monad集成了有效的会话类型语言和通用函数式语言。Nomos的原型实现具有线性时间类型检查和高效的类型重建功能，包括通过现成的线性优化自动推断资源界限。该语言的有效性是通过实现常见智能合同(如拍卖、选举和货币)的案例研究来评估的。Nomos是完全形式化的，包括类型系统、成本语义和在区块链上部署Nomos契约的事务语义。类型可靠性证明确保协议在运行时得到遵守，并且类型为资源消耗建立了可靠的上限，排除了重入和气体耗尽漏洞。
papers.title_zh: 数字合同的资源感知会话类型

papers.title: Vertical Composition and Sound Payload Abstraction for Stateful Protocols
papers.authors: Sébastien Gondron, Sebastian Mödersheim
papers.abstract: This paper deals with a problem that arises in vertical composition of protocols, i.e., when a channel protocol is used to encrypt and transport arbitrary data from an application protocol that uses the channel. Our work proves that we can verify that the channel protocol ensures its security goals independent of a particular application. More in detail, we build a general paradigm to express vertical composition of an application protocol and a channel protocol, and we give a transformation of the channel protocol where the application payload messages are replaced by abstract constants in a particular way that is feasible for standard automated verification tools. We prove that this transformation is sound for a large class of channel and application protocols. The requirements that channel and application have to satisfy for the vertical composition are all of an easy-to-check syntactic nature.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文讨论了在协议的垂直组合中出现的一个问题，即当一个通道协议被用来加密和传输来自使用该通道的应用协议的任意数据时。我们的工作证明，我们可以验证通道协议确保其安全目标独立于特定的应用程序。更详细地说，我们构建了一个通用范例来表达应用协议和通道协议的垂直组合，并且我们给出了通道协议的一个变换，其中应用有效载荷消息以一种对标准自动验证工具可行的特定方式被抽象常数所替代。我们证明了这种转换对于一大类信道和应用协议是合理的。通道和应用程序必须满足的垂直组合的要求都是易于检查的语法性质。
papers.title_zh: 有状态协议的垂直组合和合理有效载荷抽象

papers.title: Language Support for Secure Software Development with Enclaves
papers.authors: Aditya Oak, Amir M. Ahmadian, Musard Balliu, Guido Salvaneschi
papers.abstract: Confidential computing is a promising technology for securing code and data-in-use on untrusted host machines, e.g., the cloud. Many hardware vendors offer different implementations of Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs). A TEE is a hardware protected execution environment that allows performing confidential computations over sensitive data on untrusted hosts. Despite the appeal of achieving strong security guarantees against low-level attackers, two challenges hinder the adoption of TEEs. First, developing software in high-level managed languages, e.g., Java or Scala, taking advantage of existing TEEs is complex and error-prone. Second, partitioning an application into components that run inside and outside a TEE may break application-level security policies, resulting in an insecure application when facing a realistic attacker. In this work, we study both these challenges. We present JE, a programming model that seamlessly integrates a TEE, abstracting away low-level programming details such as initialization and loading of data into the TEE.
