In this paper, we investigate how to secure sensitive user information, while maintaining the flexibility of declassification, even in the presence of active attackers---those who can perform the aforementioned actions. Our approach extends prior work on secure-multi-execution with stateful declassification by treating script-generated content specially to ensure that declassification policies cannot be manipulated by them. We use a knowledge-based progress-insensitive definition of security and prove that our enforcement mechanism is sound. We further prove that our enforcement mechanism is precise and has robust declassification (i.e. active attackers cannot learn more than their passive counterpart).
papers.abstract_zh: 网页上的脚本可能会窃取敏感的用户数据。在建模和实现方面已经做了很多工作来加强网页的信息流控制(IFC)以减轻这种攻击。通常将在IFC机制中运行的脚本建模为反应式程序。然而，该模型没有考虑动态脚本行为，例如用户动作模拟、新DOM元素生成或新事件处理程序注册，这些行为可能会泄漏信息。在本文中，我们研究了如何保护敏感用户信息，同时保持解密的灵活性，即使在存在主动攻击者的情况下，这些攻击者可以执行上述操作。我们的方法通过特别处理脚本生成的内容来确保解密策略不能被它们操纵，从而扩展了先前关于具有有状态解密的安全多执行的工作。我们使用基于知识的、对进程不敏感的安全定义，并证明我们的实施机制是合理的。我们进一步证明了我们的实施机制是精确的，并且具有健壮的解密(即，主动攻击者不能比他们的被动对手了解更多)。
papers.title_zh: 基于知识的反应式程序动态秘密安全

papers.title: Assuming You Know: Epistemic Semantics of Relational Annotations for Expressive Flow Policies
papers.authors: Andrey Chudnov, David A. Naumann
papers.abstract: Many high-level security requirements are about the allowed flow of information in programs, but are difficult to make precise because they involve selective downgrading. Quite a few mutually incompatible and ad-hoc approaches have been proposed for specifying and enforcing downgrading policies. Prior surveys of these approaches have not provided a unifying technical framework. Notions from epistemic logic have emerged as a good approach to policy semantics but are considerably removed from well developed static and dynamic enforcement techniques. We develop a unified framework for expressing, giving meaning and enforcing information downgrading policies that builds on commonly known and widely deployed concepts and techniques, especially static and dynamic assertion checking. These concepts should make information flow accessible and enable developers without special training to specify precise policies. The unified framework allows to directly compare different policy specification styles and enforce them by leveraging existing techniques.
papers.abstract_zh: 许多高级别的安全需求是关于程序中允许的信息流，但是很难精确，因为它们涉及选择性降级。已经提出了相当多的互不兼容的和特别的方法来指定和执行降级策略。先前对这些方法的调查没有提供统一的技术框架。来自认知逻辑的概念已经成为策略语义的一种好方法，但是与成熟的静态和动态执行技术相去甚远。我们开发了一个统一的框架，用于表达、赋予意义和执行信息降级策略，该框架基于众所周知且广泛部署的概念和技术，尤其是静态和动态断言检查。这些概念应该使信息流易于访问，并使没有经过特殊培训的开发人员能够指定精确的策略。统一框架允许直接比较不同的策略规范风格，并通过利用现有技术来实施它们。
papers.title_zh: 假设您知道:用于表达流策略的关系注释的认知语义

papers.title: KEVM: A Complete Formal Semantics of the Ethereum Virtual Machine
papers.authors: Everett Hildenbrandt, Manasvi Saxena, Nishant Rodrigues, Xiaoran Zhu, Philip Daian, Dwight Guth, Brandon M. Moore, Daejun Park, Yi Zhang, Andrei Stefanescu, Grigore Rosu
papers.abstract: A developing field of interest for the distributed systems and applied cryptography communities is that of smart contracts: self-executing financial instruments that synchronize their state, often through a blockchain. One such smart contract system that has seen widespread practical adoption is Ethereum, which has grown to a market capacity of 100 billion USD and clears an excess of 500,000 daily transactions. Unfortunately, the rise of these technologies has been marred by a series of costly bugs and exploits. Increasingly, the Ethereum community has turned to formal methods and rigorous program analysis tools. This trend holds great promise due to the relative simplicity of smart contracts and bounded-time deterministic execution inherent to the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). Here we present KEVM, an executable formal specification of the EVM's bytecode stack-based language built with the K Framework, designed to serve as a solid foundation for further formal analyses. We empirically evaluate the correctness and performance of KEVM using the official Ethereum test suite. To demonstrate the usability, several extensions of the semantics are presented. and two different-language implementations of the ERC20 Standard Token are verified against the ERC20 specification. These results are encouraging for the executable semantics approach to language prototyping and specification.
papers.abstract_zh: 分布式系统和应用密码学社区感兴趣的一个发展中领域是智能合约:自动执行的金融工具，通常通过区块链来同步它们的状态。以太坊(Ethereum)就是这样一个被广泛采用的智能合约系统，其市场容量已经增长到1000亿美元，每天结算超过500，000笔交易。不幸的是，这些技术的兴起被一系列代价高昂的错误和漏洞所破坏。以太坊社区越来越多地转向正式方法和严格的程序分析工具。由于智能合约的相对简单性和以太坊虚拟机(EVM)固有的有限时间确定性执行，这一趋势具有很大的前景。在这里，我们介绍KEVM，一个用K框架构建的EVM基于字节码堆栈的语言的可执行形式规范，旨在为进一步的形式分析提供坚实的基础。我们使用官方以太坊测试套件对KEVM的正确性和性能进行了经验评估。为了演示可用性，给出了语义的几个扩展。并且对照ERC20规范验证了ERC20标准令牌的两种不同语言的实现。这些结果对于语言原型和规格说明的可执行语义方法是令人鼓舞的。
papers.title_zh: KEVM:以太坊虚拟机的完整形式语义

papers.title: A Permission-Dependent Type System for Secure Information Flow Analysis
papers.authors: Hongxu Chen, Alwen Tiu, Zhiwu Xu, Yang Liu
papers.abstract: We introduce a novel type system for enforcing secure information flow in an imperative language. Our work is motivated by the problem of statically checking potential information leakage in Android applications. To this end, we design a lightweight type system featuring Android permission model, where the permissions are statically assigned to applications and are used to enforce access control in the applications. We take inspiration from a type system by Banerjee and Naumann to allow security types to be dependent on the permissions of the applications. A novel feature of our type system is a typing rule for conditional branching induced by permission testing, which introduces a merging operator on security types, allowing more precise security policies to be enforced. The soundness of our type system is proved with respect to non-interference. In addition, a type inference algorithm is presented for the underlying security type system, by reducing the inference problem to a constraint solving problem in the lattice of security types.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们介绍了一种新型系统，用于在命令式语言中实施安全信息流。我们的工作是由静态检查Android应用程序中潜在的信息泄漏问题激发的。为此，我们设计了一个以Android权限模型为特色的轻量级系统，其中权限被静态地分配给应用程序，并用于在应用程序中实施访问控制。我们从Banerjee和Naumann的类型系统中获得灵感，允许安全类型依赖于应用程序的权限。我们的类型系统的一个新特性是一个由权限测试引起的条件分支的类型规则，它引入了一个安全类型的合并操作符，允许执行更精确的安全策略。我们的类型系统在无干扰方面是可靠的。此外，通过将推理问题归结为安全类型格中的约束求解问题，给出了底层安全类型系统的类型推理算法。
papers.title_zh: 用于安全信息流分析的权限相关型系统

papers.title: Types for Information Flow Control: Labeling Granularity and Semantic Models
papers.authors: Vineet Rajani, Deepak Garg
papers.abstract: Language-based information flow control (IFC) tracks dependencies within a program using sensitivity labels and prohibits public outputs from depending on secret inputs. In particular, literature has proposed several type systems for tracking these dependencies. On one extreme, there are fine-grained type systems (like Flow Caml) that label all values individually and track dependence at the level of individual values. On the other extreme are coarse-grained type systems (like HLIO) that track dependence coarsely, by associating a single label with an entire computation context and not labeling all values individually. In this paper, we show that, despite their glaring differences, both these styles are, in fact, equally expressive. To do this, we show a semantics- and type-preserving translation from a coarse-grained type system to a fine-grained one and vice-versa. The forward translation isn't surprising, but the backward translation is: It requires a construct to arbitrarily limit the scope of a context label in the coarse-grained type system (e.g., HLIO's ``toLabeled'' construct). As a separate contribution, we show how to extend work on logical relation models of IFC types to higher-order state. We build such logical relations for both the fine-grained type system and the coarse-grained type system. We use these relations to prove the two type systems and our translations between them sound.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于语言的信息流控制(IFC)使用敏感性标签跟踪程序内的依赖性，并禁止公共输出依赖于秘密输入。特别是，文献已经提出了几种类型的系统来跟踪这些依赖性。在一个极端，有细粒度的类型系统(如Flow Caml ),它们分别标记所有的值，并在单个值的层次上跟踪依赖性。另一个极端是粗粒度类型系统(如HLIO ),通过将单个标签与整个计算上下文相关联，而不是单独标记所有值，粗略地跟踪依赖性。在本文中，我们表明，尽管它们有明显的差异，这两种风格实际上是一样的表达。为此，我们展示了从粗粒度类型系统到细粒度类型系统的语义和类型保持转换，反之亦然。正向转换并不令人惊讶，但反向转换令人惊讶:它需要一个构造来任意限制粗粒度类型系统中上下文标签的范围(例如，HLIO的“toLabeled”构造)。作为一个单独的贡献，我们展示了如何将IFC类型的逻辑关系模型的工作扩展到更高阶的状态。我们为细粒度类型系统和粗粒度类型系统建立这样的逻辑关系。我们用这些关系来证明这两种类型的系统和我们在它们之间的翻译是合理的。
papers.title_zh: 信息流控制的类型:标记粒度和语义模型

papers.title: Inductive Invariants for Noninterference in Multi-agent Workflows
papers.authors: Christian Müller, Helmut Seidl, Eugen Zalinescu
papers.abstract: Our goal is to certify absence of information leaks in multi-agent workflows, such as conference management systems like EasyChair. These workflows can be executed by any number of agents some of which may form coalitions against the system. Therefore, checking noninterference is a challenging problem. Our paper offers two main contributions: First, a technique is provided to translate noninterference (in presence of various agent capabilities and declassification conditions) into universally quantified invariants of an instrumented new workflow program. Second, general techniques are developed for checking and inferring universally quantified inductive invariants for workflow programs. In particular, a large class of workflows is identified where inductiveness of invariants is decidable, as well as a smaller, still useful class of workflows where the weakest inductive universal invariant implying the desired invariant, is effectively computable. The new algorithms are implemented and applied to certify noninterference for workflows arising from conference management systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们的目标是证明在多代理工作流中不存在信息泄漏，例如像EasyChair这样的会议管理系统。这些工作流可以由任意数量的代理执行，其中一些代理可能形成针对系统的联盟。因此，检查不干涉是一个具有挑战性的问题。我们的论文提供了两个主要的贡献:第一，提供了一种技术来将不干涉(在存在各种代理能力和解密条件的情况下)转换成一个工具化的新工作流程序的通用量化不变量。第二，开发了检查和推断工作流程序的通用量化归纳不变量的通用技术。特别地，识别一大类工作流，其中不变量的归纳性是可判定的，以及一个更小的、仍然有用的工作流类，其中隐含期望不变量的最弱归纳通用不变量是可有效计算的。新算法被实现并应用于证明来自会议管理系统的工作流的不干扰。
papers.title_zh: 多代理工作流中不干涉的归纳不变量

papers.title: Invited Paper: Local Differential Privacy on Metric Spaces: Optimizing the Trade-Off with Utility
papers.authors: Mário S. Alvim, Konstantinos Chatzikokolakis, Catuscia Palamidessi, Anna Pazii
papers.abstract: Local differential privacy (LPD) is a distributed variant of differential privacy (DP) in which the obfuscation of the sensitive information is done at the level of the individual records, and in general it is used to sanitize data that are collected for statistical purposes. LPD has the advantage it does not need to assume a trusted third party. On the other hand LDP in general requires more noise than DP to achieve the same level of protection, with negative consequences on the utility. In practice, utility becomes acceptable only on very large collections of data, and this is the reason why LDP is especially successful among big companies such as Apple and Google, which can count on a huge number of users. In this talk, we propose a variant of LDP suitable for metric spaces, such as location data or energy consumption data, and we show that it provides a much higher utility for the same level of privacy. Furthermore, we discuss algorithms to extract the best possible statistical information from the data obfuscated with this metric variant of LDP.
papers.abstract_zh: 本地差分隐私(LPD)是差分隐私(DP)的一种分布式变体，其中敏感信息的模糊处理是在单个记录的级别上完成的，通常用于整理出于统计目的而收集的数据。LPD的优势在于它不需要假设一个可信的第三方。另一方面，一般来说，LDP比DP需要更多的噪声来达到相同的保护水平，这对电力公司有负面影响。在实践中，效用只有在非常大的数据集合中才变得可接受，这就是为什么LDP在苹果和谷歌等大公司中特别成功的原因，这些公司可以依靠大量的用户。在本次演讲中，我们提出了一种适用于度量空间的LDP变体，如位置数据或能耗数据，并且我们表明它为相同级别的隐私提供了更高的效用。此外，我们还讨论了从使用LDP的这种度量变体混淆的数据中提取最佳可能统计信息的算法。
papers.title_zh: 特邀论文:度量空间上的局部微分隐私:优化与效用的权衡

papers.title: Privacy Risk in Machine Learning: Analyzing the Connection to Overfitting
papers.authors: Samuel Yeom, Irene Giacomelli, Matt Fredrikson, Somesh Jha
papers.abstract: Machine learning algorithms, when applied to sensitive data, pose a distinct threat to privacy. A growing body of prior work demonstrates that models produced by these algorithms may leak specific private information in the training data to an attacker, either through the models' structure or their observable behavior. However, the underlying cause of this privacy risk is not well understood beyond a handful of anecdotal accounts that suggest overfitting and influence might play a role. This paper examines the effect that overfitting and influence have on the ability of an attacker to learn information about the training data from machine learning models, either through training set membership inference or attribute inference attacks. Using both formal and empirical analyses, we illustrate a clear relationship between these factors and the privacy risk that arises in several popular machine learning algorithms. We find that overfitting is sufficient to allow an attacker to perform membership inference and, when the target attribute meets certain conditions about its influence, attribute inference attacks. Interestingly, our formal analysis also shows that overfitting is not necessary for these attacks and begins to shed light on what other factors may be in play. Finally, we explore the connection between membership inference and attribute inference, showing that there are deep connections between the two that lead to effective new attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 当应用于敏感数据时，机器学习算法对隐私构成了明显的威胁。越来越多的现有工作表明，这些算法生成的模型可能会通过模型的结构或其可观察的行为，将训练数据中的特定私人信息泄露给攻击者。然而，这种隐私风险的潜在原因并没有得到很好的理解，除了少数轶事，表明过度适应和影响可能发挥了作用。本文研究了过度拟合和影响对攻击者通过训练集成员推理或属性推理攻击从机器学习模型中学习关于训练数据的信息的能力的影响。使用正式和实证分析，我们说明了这些因素和几个流行的机器学习算法中出现的隐私风险之间的明确关系。我们发现过度拟合足以允许攻击者执行成员推理，并且当目标属性满足关于其影响的某些条件时，属性推理攻击。有趣的是，我们的正式分析还表明，过度拟合对这些攻击并不是必要的，并开始揭示其他因素可能在起作用。最后，我们探讨了成员推理和属性推理之间的联系，表明这两者之间有着深刻的联系，导致有效的新攻击。
papers.title_zh: 机器学习中的隐私风险:分析与过度拟合的关系

papers.title: Alethea: A Provably Secure Random Sample Voting Protocol
papers.authors: David A. Basin, Sasa Radomirovic, Lara Schmid
papers.abstract: In random sample voting, only a randomly chosen subset of all eligible voters are selected to vote. This poses new security challenges for the voting protocol used. In particular, one must ensure that the chosen voters were randomly selected while preserving their anonymity. Moreover, the small number of selected voters leaves little room for error and only a few manipulations of the votes may significantly change the outcome. We propose Alethea, the first random sample voting protocol that satisfies end-to-end verifiability and receipt-freeness. Our protocol makes explicit the distinction between human voters and their devices. This allows for more fine-grained statements about the required capabilities and trust assumptions of each agent than is possible in previous work. We define new security properties related to the randomness and anonymity of the sample group and the probability of undetected manipulations. We prove correctness of the protocol and its properties both using traditional paper and pen proofs and with tool support.
papers.abstract_zh: 在随机抽样投票中，只有随机选择的所有合格投票者的子集被选中投票。这对所使用的投票协议提出了新的安全挑战。特别是，我们必须确保被选中的选民是随机选择的，同时保持他们的匿名性。此外，被选中的选民人数少，几乎没有出错的余地，只要对投票进行一些操纵，就可能显著改变结果。我们提出了Alethea，第一个满足端到端可验证性和无回执的随机抽样投票协议。我们的协议明确区分了人类投票者和他们的设备。与以前的工作相比，这允许对每个代理所需的能力和信任假设进行更细粒度的陈述。我们定义了与样本组的随机性和匿名性以及未被检测到的操纵的概率相关的新的安全属性。我们使用传统的纸笔证明和工具支持证明了协议及其性质的正确性。
papers.title_zh: Alethea:一个可证明安全的随机样本投票协议

papers.title: Machine-Checked Proofs for Electronic Voting: Privacy and Verifiability for Belenios
papers.authors: Véronique Cortier, Constantin Catalin Dragan, François Dupressoir, Bogdan Warinschi
papers.abstract: We present a machine-checked security analysis of Belenios -- a deployed voting protocol used already in more than 200 elections. Belenios extends Helios with an explicit registration authority to obtain eligibility guarantees. We offer two main results. First, we build upon a recent framework for proving ballot privacy in EasyCrypt. Inspired by our application to Belenios, we adapt and extend the privacy security notions to account for protocols that include a registration phase. Our analysis identifies a trust assumption which is missing in the existing (pen and paper) analysis of Belenios: ballot privacy does not hold if the registrar misbehaves, even if the role of the registrar is seemingly to provide eligibility guarantees. Second, we develop a novel framework for proving strong verifiability in EasyCrypt and apply it to Belenios. In the process, we clarify several aspects of the pen-and-paper proof, such as how to deal with revote policies. Together, our results yield the first machine-checked analysis of both ballot privacy and verifiability properties for a deployed electronic voting protocol. Perhaps more importantly, we identify several issues regarding the applicability of existing definitions of privacy and verifiability to systems other than Helios. While we show how to adapt the definitions to the particular case of Belenios, our findings indicate the need for more general security notions for electronic voting protocols with registration authorities.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个机器检查的安全分析Belenios -一个部署的投票协议已经在200多个选举中使用。Belenios用一个明确的注册机构扩展了Helios，以获得资格保证。我们提供两个主要结果。首先，我们在EasyCrypt中建立了一个证明投票隐私的最新框架。受Belenios应用程序的启发，我们调整并扩展了隐私安全概念，以考虑包含注册阶段的协议。我们的分析确定了一个信任假设，该假设在现有的对Belenios的分析(笔和纸)中缺失:如果注册商行为不当，投票隐私不成立，即使注册商的角色看起来是提供资格保证。其次，我们开发了一个新的框架来证明EasyCrypt中的强可验证性，并将其应用于Belenios。在此过程中，我们阐明了纸笔证明的几个方面，如如何处理撤销保单。总的来说，我们的结果产生了对已部署的电子投票协议的投票隐私和可验证性属性的第一次机器检查分析。也许更重要的是，我们发现了几个关于隐私和可验证性的现有定义对Helios以外的系统的适用性的问题。虽然我们展示了如何将这些定义适用于特定的Belenios情况，但我们的发现表明，对于具有注册机构的电子投票协议，需要更一般的安全概念。
papers.title_zh: 电子投票的机器检验证明:Belenios的保密性和可验证性

papers.title: Symbolic Side-Channel Analysis for Probabilistic Programs
papers.authors: Pasquale Malacaria, M. H. R. Khouzani, Corina S. Pasareanu, Quoc-Sang Phan, Kasper Søe Luckow
papers.abstract: In this paper we describe symbolic side-channel analysis techniques for detecting and quantifying information leakage, given in terms of Shannon and min-entropy. Measuring the precise leakage is challenging due to the randomness and noise often present in program executions and side-channel observations. We account for this noise by introducing additional (symbolic) program inputs which are interpreted probabilistically, using symbolic execution with parametrized model counting. We also explore a sampling approach for increased scalability. In contrast to typical Monte Carlo techniques, our approach works by sampling symbolic paths, representing multiple concrete paths, and uses pruning to accelerate computation and guarantee convergence to the optimal results. A key novelty of our approach is to provide bounds on the leakage that are provably under- and over-approximating the exact leakage. We implemented the techniques in the Symbolic PathFinder tool and demonstrate them on Java programs.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们描述了符号旁道分析技术检测和量化信息泄漏，根据香农和最小熵。由于程序执行和旁道观测中经常存在随机性和噪声，精确测量泄漏具有挑战性。我们通过引入额外的(符号化的)程序输入来解决这种噪声，这些程序输入被概率性地解释，使用带有参数化模型计数的符号化执行。我们还探索了一种提高可伸缩性的采样方法。与典型的蒙特卡罗技术相比，我们的方法通过对代表多个具体路径的符号路径进行采样来工作，并使用剪枝来加速计算并保证收敛到最优结果。我们方法的一个关键新颖之处是提供了泄漏的界限，可证明该界限低于和高于精确泄漏的近似值。我们在符号探路者工具中实现了这些技术，并在Java程序中演示了它们。
papers.title_zh: 概率程序的符号旁道分析

papers.title: Secure Compilation of Side-Channel Countermeasures: The Case of Cryptographic "Constant-Time"
papers.authors: Gilles Barthe, Benjamin Grégoire, Vincent Laporte
papers.abstract: Software-based countermeasures provide effective mitigation against side-channel attacks, often with minimal efficiency and deployment overheads. Their effectiveness is often amenable to rigorous analysis: specifically, several popular countermeasures can be formalized as information flow policies, and correct implementation of the countermeasures can be verified with state-of-the-art analysis and verification techniques. However, in absence of further justification, the guarantees only hold for the language (source, target, or intermediate representation) on which the analysis is performed. We consider the problem of preserving side-channel counter-measures by compilation for cryptographic “constant-time”, a popular countermeasure against cache-based timing attacks. We present a general method, based on the notion of constant-time-simulation, for proving that a compilation pass preserves the constant-time countermeasure. Using the Coq proof assistant, we verify the correctness of our method and of several representative instantiations.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于软件的对策可有效缓解侧信道攻击，通常效率和部署开销极低。它们的有效性通常经得起严格的分析:具体来说，可以将几种流行的对策形式化为信息流策略，并且可以使用最先进的分析和验证技术来验证对策的正确实现。然而，在没有进一步证明的情况下，这些保证仅适用于执行分析的语言(源、目标或中间表示)。我们考虑通过加密“常数时间”的编译来保持旁路对策的问题，这是一种针对基于缓存的计时攻击的流行对策。我们提出了一种基于恒定时间模拟概念的通用方法，用于证明编译通过保持恒定时间对策。使用Coq proof assistant，我们验证了我们的方法和几个代表性实例的正确性。
papers.title_zh: 边信道对策的安全编译:密码“常数时间”的情况

papers.title: A Little More Conversation, a Little Less Action, a Lot More Satisfaction: Global States in ProVerif
papers.authors: Vincent Cheval, Véronique Cortier, Mathieu Turuani
papers.abstract: ProVerif is a popular tool for the fully automatic analysis of security protocols, offering very good support to detect flaws or prove security. One exception is the case of protocols with global states such as counters, tables, or more generally, memory cells. ProVerif fails to analyse such protocols, due to its internal abstraction. Our key idea is to devise a generic transformation of the security properties queried to ProVerif. We prove the soundness of our transformation and implement it into a front-end GSVerif. Our experiments show that our front-end (combined with ProVerif) outperforms the few existing tools, both in terms of efficiency and protocol coverage. We successfully apply our tool to a dozen of protocols of the literature, yielding the first fully automatic proof of a security API and a payment protocol of the literature.
papers.abstract_zh: ProVerif是一个流行的安全协议全自动分析工具，为检测缺陷或证明安全性提供了很好的支持。一个例外是具有全局状态的协议，如计数器、表或更一般的存储单元。由于其内部的抽象性，ProVerif无法分析这样的协议。我们的主要想法是设计一个查询到ProVerif的安全属性的通用转换。我们证明了我们的转换的合理性，并将其实现到一个前端GSVerif中。我们的实验表明，我们的前端(结合ProVerif)在效率和协议覆盖方面都优于现有的少数工具。我们成功地将我们的工具应用于十几个文献中的协议，产生了第一个文献中的安全API和支付协议的全自动证明。
papers.title_zh: 多一点对话，少一点行动，多一点满足:谚语中的全球状态

papers.title: Automated Unbounded Verification of Stateful Cryptographic Protocols with Exclusive OR
papers.authors: Jannik Dreier, Lucca Hirschi, Sasa Radomirovic, Ralf Sasse
papers.abstract: Exclusive-or (XOR) operations are common in cryptographic protocols, in particular in RFID protocols and electronic payment protocols. Although there are numerous applications, due to the inherent complexity of faithful models of XOR, there is only limited tool support for the verification of cryptographic protocols using XOR. The Tamarin prover is a state-of-the-art verification tool for cryptographic protocols in the symbolic model. In this paper, we improve the underlying theory and the tool to deal with an equational theory modeling XOR operations. The XOR theory can be freely combined with all equational theories previously supported, including user-defined equational theories. This makes Tamarin the first tool to support simultaneously this large set of equational theories, protocols with global mutable state, an unbounded number of sessions, and complex security properties including observational equivalence. We demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach by analyzing several protocols that rely on XOR, in particular multiple RFID-protocols, where we can identify attacks as well as provide proofs.
papers.abstract_zh: 异或(XOR)运算在密码协议中很常见，特别是在RFID协议和电子支付协议中。尽管有许多应用，但是由于XOR的忠实模型的固有复杂性，对于使用XOR验证密码协议，只有有限的工具支持。Tamarin证明者是一个在符号模型中用于密码协议的最先进的验证工具。在本文中，我们改进了基础理论和工具来处理一个模拟异或运算的方程理论。XOR理论可以与以前支持的所有方程式理论自由组合，包括用户定义的方程式理论。这使得Tamarin成为第一个同时支持这一大套等式理论、具有全局可变状态的协议、无限数量的会话以及包括观察等价在内的复杂安全属性的工具。我们通过分析几个依赖于XOR的协议，特别是多个RFID协议，证明了我们的方法的有效性，在这些协议中，我们可以识别攻击并提供证据。
papers.title_zh: 用异或实现有状态密码协议的自动无界验证

papers.title: A Typing Result for Stateful Protocols
papers.authors: Andreas V. Hess, Sebastian Mödersheim
papers.abstract: There are several typing results that, for certain classes of protocols, show it is without loss of attacks to restrict the intruder to sending only well-typed messages. So far, all these typing results hold only for relatively simple protocols that do not keep a state beyond single sessions, excluding stateful protocols that, e.g., maintain long-term databases. Recently, several verification tools for stateful protocols have been proposed, e.g., Set-pi, AIF-omega, and SAPIC/Tamarin, but for none of these a typing result has been established. The main contribution of this paper is a typing result, for a large class of stateful protocols, based on a symbolic protocol model. We illustrate how to connect several formalisms for stateful protocols to this symbolic model. Finally, we discuss how the conditions of our typing result apply to existing protocols, or can be achieved by minor modifications.
papers.abstract_zh: 对于某些类别的协议，有几个类型结果表明，限制入侵者只发送类型良好的消息不会造成攻击损失。到目前为止，所有这些分型结果仅适用于相对简单的协议，这些协议不保持单个会话之外的状态，不包括例如维护长期数据库的有状态协议。最近，已经提出了几种用于有状态协议的验证工具，例如Set-pi、AIF-欧米伽和SAPIC/Tamarin，但是对于这些都没有建立分型结果。本文的主要贡献是基于符号协议模型，对一大类有状态协议进行了分类。我们说明了如何将有状态协议的几种形式与这个符号模型联系起来。最后，我们讨论我们的分型结果的条件如何应用于现有的协议，或者可以通过微小的修改来实现。
papers.title_zh: 有状态协议的分类结果

papers.title: Analyzing First-Order Role Based Access Control
papers.authors: Carlos Cotrini Jiménez, Thilo Weghorn, David A. Basin, Manuel Clavel
papers.abstract: We propose FORBAC, an extension of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) based on first-order logic. FORBAC is expressive enough to formalize a wide range of access control policies. However, it is simple enough so that relevant policy analysis queries can be analyzed in NP, which we argue is a natural complexity class for this problem. To analyze queries efficiently, we reduce them to the problem of satisfiability modulo appropriate theories, and use off-the-shelf SMT solvers. We evaluate FORBAC's expressiveness and our approach to policy analysis in a case study, analyzing access control in a European bank.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了FORBAC，它是基于一阶逻辑的基于角色的访问控制(RBAC)的扩展。FORBAC的表达能力足以形式化各种各样的访问控制策略。然而，它足够简单，因此相关的策略分析查询可以在NP中进行分析，我们认为NP是这个问题的自然复杂性类。为了有效地分析查询，我们将它们简化为以适当的理论为模的可满足性问题，并使用现成的SMT求解器。我们在一个案例研究中评估了FORBAC的表达能力和我们的策略分析方法，分析了一家欧洲银行的访问控制。
papers.title_zh: 基于一阶角色的访问控制分析

papers.title: Decomposing, Comparing, and Synthesizing Access Control Expressiveness Simulations
papers.authors: William C. Garrison III, Adam J. Lee
papers.abstract: Access control is fundamental to computer security, and has thus been the subject of extensive formal study. In particular, relative expressiveness analysis techniques have used formal mappings called simulations to explore whether one access control system is capable of emulating another, thereby comparing the expressive power of these systems. Unfortunately, the notions of expressiveness simulation that have been explored vary widely, which makes it difficult to compare results in the literature, and even leads to apparent contradictions between results. Furthermore, some notions of expressiveness simulation make use of non-determinism, and thus cannot be used to define mappings between access control systems that are useful in practical scenarios. In this work, we define the minimum set of properties for an implementable access control simulation, i.e., a deterministic "recipe" for using one system in place of another. We then define a wide range of properties spread across several dimensions that can be enforced on top of this minimum definition. These properties define a taxonomy that can be used to separate and compare existing notions of access control simulation, many of which were previously incomparable. We position existing notions of simulation within our properties lattice by formally proving each simulation's equivalence to a corresponding set of properties. Lastly, we take steps towards bridging the gap between theory and practice by exploring the systems implications of points within our properties lattice. This shows that relative expressive analysis is more than just a theoretical tool, and can also guide the choice of the most suitable access control system for a specific application or scenario.
papers.abstract_zh: 访问控制是计算机安全的基础，因此成为广泛正式研究的主题。特别地，相对表达性分析技术已经使用被称为模拟的形式映射来探索一个访问控制系统是否能够模拟另一个，从而比较这些系统的表达能力。不幸的是，已经探索的表现力模拟的概念变化很大，这使得很难比较文献中的结果，甚至导致结果之间的明显矛盾。此外，表达模拟的一些概念利用了非确定性，因此不能用于定义在实际场景中有用的访问控制系统之间的映射。在这项工作中，我们定义了可实现的访问控制模拟的最小属性集，即使用一个系统代替另一个系统的确定性“配方”。然后，我们定义跨几个维度的大量属性，这些属性可以在这个最小定义的基础上实施。这些属性定义了一个分类法，可用于分离和比较现有的访问控制模拟概念，其中许多概念在以前是不可比的。我们通过正式证明每个模拟与相应的一组属性的等价性，在我们的属性格中定位现有的模拟概念。最后，我们采取措施，通过探索我们的属性网格内点的系统含义来弥合理论和实践之间的差距。这表明相对表达分析不仅仅是一个理论工具，还可以指导选择最适合特定应用或场景的访问控制系统。
papers.title_zh: 分解、比较和合成访问控制表达模拟

papers.title: Compositional Typed Analysis of ARBAC Policies
papers.authors: Stefano Calzavara, Alvise Rabitti, Michele Bugliesi
papers.abstract: Model-checking is a popular approach to the security analysis of ARBAC policies, but its effectiveness is hindered by the exponential explosion of the ways in which different users can be assigned to different role combinations. In this paper we propose a paradigm shift, based on the observation that, while verifying ARBAC by exhaustive state search is complex, realistic policies often have rather simple security proofs, and we propose to use types as an effective tool to leverage this simplicity. Concretely, we present a static type system to verify the security of ARBAC policies, along with a sound and complete type inference algorithm used to automate the verification process. We then introduce compositionality results, which identify sufficient conditions to preserve the security guarantees obtained by the verification of different sub-policies when these sub-policies are combined together: this compositional reasoning is crucial when policy administration is highly distributed and naturally supports the security analysis of evolving ARBAC policies. We evaluate our approach by implementing TAPA, a static analyser for ARBAC policies based on our theory, which we test on a number of relatively large, publicly available policies from the literature.
papers.abstract_zh: 模型检查是对ARBAC策略进行安全性分析的一种流行方法，但它的有效性受到了将不同用户分配到不同角色组合的方法的指数式增长的阻碍。在本文中，我们提出了一种范式转换，基于这样的观察:虽然通过穷举状态搜索来验证ARBAC是复杂的，但是现实的策略通常具有相当简单的安全性证明，并且我们建议使用类型作为有效的工具来利用这种简单性。具体地说，我们提出了一个静态类型系统来验证ARBAC策略的安全性，以及一个用于自动化验证过程的可靠和完整的类型推理算法。然后，我们引入组合性结果，当这些子策略被组合在一起时，组合性结果确定了保持通过不同子策略的验证获得的安全保证的充分条件:当策略管理高度分布时，这种组合推理是至关重要的，并且自然地支持演进的ARBAC策略的安全分析。我们通过实现TAPA来评估我们的方法，TAPA是一个基于我们理论的ARBAC策略的静态分析器，我们在文献中大量相对较大的公开策略上测试了它。
papers.title_zh: ARBAC政策的组合类型分析

papers.title: Policy Privacy in Cryptographic Access Control
papers.authors: Anna Lisa Ferrara, Georg Fuchsbauer, Bin Liu, Bogdan Warinschi
papers.abstract: Cryptographic access control offers selective access to encrypted data via a combination of key management and functionality-rich cryptographic schemes, such as attribute-based encryption. Using this approach, publicly available meta-data may inadvertently leak information on the access policy that is enforced by cryptography, which renders cryptographic access control unusable in settings where this information is highly sensitive. We begin to address this problem by presenting rigorous definitions for policy privacy in cryptographic access control. For concreteness we set our results in the model of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), where we identify and formalize several different flavors of privacy, however, our framework should serve as inspiration for other models of access control. Based on our insights we propose a new system which significantly improves on the privacy properties of state-of-the-art constructions. Our design is based on a novel type of privacy-preserving attribute-based encryption, which we introduce and show how to instantiate. We present our results in the context of a cryptographic RBAC system by Ferrara et al. (CSF'13), which uses cryptography to control read access to files, while write access is still delegated to trusted monitors. We give an extension of the construction that permits cryptographic control over write access. Our construction assumes that key management uses out-of-band channels between the policy enforcer and the users but eliminates completely the need for monitoring read/write access to the data.
papers.abstract_zh: 加密访问控制通过结合密钥管理和功能丰富的加密方案(如基于属性的加密)来提供对加密数据的选择性访问。使用这种方法，公开可用的元数据可能会无意中泄露由加密技术实施的访问策略的信息，这使得加密访问控制在该信息高度敏感的设置中不可用。我们开始通过提出加密访问控制中策略隐私的严格定义来解决这个问题。为了具体起见，我们在基于角色的访问控制(RBAC)模型中设置了我们的结果，在该模型中，我们识别并形式化了几种不同的隐私风格，然而，我们的框架应该作为其他访问控制模型的灵感。基于我们的见解，我们提出了一个新的系统，大大改善了最先进的建设状态的隐私属性。我们的设计是基于一种新型的隐私保护的基于属性的加密，我们介绍并展示了如何实例化。我们在Ferrara等人的加密RBAC系统(CSF'13)的背景下展示了我们的结果，该系统使用加密技术来控制对文件的读访问，而写访问仍然委托给可信监视器。我们给出了允许对写访问进行加密控制的构造的扩展。我们的结构假设密钥管理使用策略实施者和用户之间的带外通道，但完全消除了监控数据读/写访问的需要。
papers.title_zh: 密码访问控制中的策略隐私

papers.title: Location Privacy via Differential Private Perturbation of Cloaking Area
papers.authors: Hoa Ngo, Jong Kim
papers.abstract: The increasing use of mobile devices has triggered the development of location based services (LBS). By providing location information to LBS, mobile users can enjoy variety of useful applications utilizing location information, but might suffer the troubles of private information leakage. Location information of mobile users needs to be kept secret while maintaining utility to achieve desirable service quality. Existing location privacy enhancing techniques based on K-anonymity and Hilbertcurve cloaking area generation showed advantages in privacy protection and service quality but disadvantages due to the generation of large cloaking areas that makes query processing and communication less effective. In this paper we propose a novel location privacy preserving scheme that leverages some differential privacy based notions and mechanisms to publish the optimal size cloaking areas from multiple rotated and shifted versions of Hilbert curve. With experimental results, we show that our scheme significantly reduces the average size of cloaking areas compared to previous Hilbert curve method. We also show how to quantify adversary's ability to perform an inference attack on user location data and how to limit adversary's success rate under a designed threshold.
papers.abstract_zh: 移动设备使用的增加引发了基于位置的服务(LBS)的发展。通过向LBS提供位置信息，移动用户可以利用位置信息享受各种有用的应用，但可能遭受隐私信息泄露的困扰。移动用户的位置信息需要保密，同时保持实用性以实现期望的服务质量。基于K-匿名和Hilbertcurve遮盖区域生成的现有位置隐私增强技术在隐私保护和服务质量方面表现出优势，但由于大遮盖区域的生成使得查询处理和通信效率较低，因此存在缺点。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的位置隐私保护方案，该方案利用一些基于差分隐私的概念和机制，从希尔伯特曲线的多个旋转和平移版本中发布最佳大小的隐藏区域。实验结果表明，与以前的希尔伯特曲线方法相比，我们的方案显著减小了掩盖区域的平均大小。我们还展示了如何量化对手对用户位置数据进行推理攻击的能力，以及如何将对手的成功率限制在一个设计的阈值之下。
papers.title_zh: 通过隐形区域的差分私密扰动的位置私密性

papers.title: Automatic Proofs of Privacy of Secure Multi-party Computation Protocols against Active Adversaries
papers.authors: Martin Pettai, Peeter Laud
papers.abstract: We describe an automatic analysis to check secure multi-party computation protocols against privacy leaks. The analysis is sound -- a protocol that is deemed private does not leak anything about its private inputs, even if active attacks are performed against it. Privacy against active adversaries is an essential ingredient in constructions aiming to provide security (privacy + correctness) in adversarial models of intermediate (between passive and active) strength. Using our analysis we are able to show that the protocols used by the SHAREMIND secure multi-party computation platform are actively private.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们描述了一种自动分析来检查安全多方计算协议防止隐私泄露。这个分析是合理的——一个被认为是私有的协议不会泄露任何关于其私有输入的信息，即使对它进行了主动攻击。针对主动对手的隐私是旨在提供中等(介于被动和主动之间)强度的对抗模型中的安全性(隐私+正确性)的结构中的基本成分。使用我们的分析，我们能够表明SHAREMIND安全多方计算平台使用的协议是主动私有的。
papers.title_zh: 针对主动对手的安全多方计算协议保密性的自动证明

papers.title: A Game-Theoretic Study on Non-monetary Incentives in Data Analytics Projects with Privacy Implications
papers.authors: Michela Chessa, Jens Grossklags, Patrick Loiseau
papers.abstract: The amount of personal information contributed by individuals to digital repositories such as social network sites has grown substantially. The existence of this data offers unprecedented opportunities for data analytics research in various domains of societal importance including medicine and public policy. The results of these analyses can be considered a public good which benefits data contributors as well as individuals who are not making their data available. At the same time, the release of personal information carries perceived and actual privacy risks to the contributors. Our research addresses this problem area. In our work, we study a game-theoretic model in which individuals take control over participation in data analytics projects in two ways: 1) individuals can contribute data at a self-chosen level of precision, and 2) individuals can decide whether they want to contribute at all (or not). From the analyst's perspective, we investigate to which degree the research analyst has flexibility to set requirements for data precision, so that individuals are still willing to contribute to the project, and the quality of the estimation improves. We study this tradeoffs scenario for populations of homogeneous and heterogeneous individuals, and determine Nash equilibrium that reflect the optimal level of participation and precision of contributions. We further prove that the analyst can substantially increase the accuracy of the analysis by imposing a lower bound on the precision of the data that users can reveal.
papers.abstract_zh: 由个人贡献给诸如社交网站的数字存储库的个人信息的数量已经显著增长。这些数据的存在为包括医学和公共政策在内的各种社会重要领域的数据分析研究提供了前所未有的机会。这些分析的结果可被视为一种公共产品，对数据提供者和不提供数据的个人都有好处。同时，个人信息的发布会给贡献者带来感知和实际的隐私风险。我们的研究解决了这个问题。在我们的工作中，我们研究了一个博弈论模型，其中个人以两种方式控制数据分析项目的参与:1)个人可以在自我选择的精确度水平上贡献数据，2)个人可以决定他们是否想要贡献(或不贡献)。从分析师的角度来看，我们调查研究分析师在多大程度上可以灵活地设置数据精度的要求，以便个人仍然愿意为项目做出贡献，并且估计的质量得到提高。我们研究了同质和异质个体群体的这种权衡方案，并确定了反映最佳参与水平和贡献精确度的纳什均衡。我们进一步证明，分析师可以通过对用户可以揭示的数据的精度施加一个下限来大大提高分析的准确性。
papers.title_zh: 隐私数据分析项目中非货币激励的博弈研究

papers.title: A Cut Principle for Information Flow
papers.authors: Joshua D. Guttman, Paul D. Rowe
papers.abstract: We view a distributed system as a graph of active locations with unidirectional channels between them, through which they pass messages. In this context, the graph structure of a system constrains the propagation of information through it. Suppose a set of channels is a cut set between an information source and a potential sink. We prove that, if there is no disclosure from the source to the cut set, then there can be no disclosure to the sink. We introduce a new formalization of partial disclosure, called blur operators, and show that the same cut property is preserved for disclosure to within a blur operator. A related compositional principle ensures limited disclosure for a class of systems that differ only beyond the cut.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们将分布式系统视为活动位置的图形，这些位置之间有单向通道，它们通过这些通道传递消息。在这种情况下，系统的图形结构限制了信息的传播。假设一组信道是信息源和潜在接收器之间的割集。我们证明，如果没有从源到割集的公开，那么就没有到接收器的公开。我们引入了一种新的部分公开的形式化方法，称为模糊算子，并表明对于在模糊算子中的公开，相同的切割性质是保留的。一个相关的组成原则确保了对一类系统的有限披露，这些系统的不同之处仅在于切割。
papers.title_zh: 信息流的切割原理

papers.title: The Anatomy and Facets of Dynamic Policies
papers.authors: Niklas Broberg, Bart van Delft, David Sands
papers.abstract: Information flow policies are often dynamic, the security concerns of a program will typically change during execution to reflect security-relevant events. A key challenge is how to best specify, and give proper meaning to, such dynamic policies. A large number of approaches exist that tackle that challenge, each yielding some important, but unconnected, insight. In this work we synthesise existing knowledge on dynamic policies, with an aim to establish a common terminology, best practices, and frameworks for reasoning about them. We introduce the concept of facets to illuminate subtleties in the semantics of policies, and closely examine the anatomy of policies and the expressiveness of policy specification mechanisms. We further explore the relation between dynamic policies and the concept of declassification.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息流策略通常是动态的，程序的安全问题通常会在执行过程中发生变化，以反映与安全相关的事件。一个关键的挑战是如何最好地规定这种动态政策，并赋予其适当的含义。有许多方法可以应对这一挑战，每种方法都产生了一些重要但不相关的见解。在这项工作中，我们综合了动态政策的现有知识，旨在建立一个通用的术语、最佳实践和推理框架。我们引入了方面的概念来阐明策略语义中的微妙之处，并仔细研究了策略的剖析和策略规范机制的表达。我们进一步探讨了动态策略和解密概念之间的关系。
papers.title_zh: 动态策略的剖析和方面

papers.title: Hybrid Monitors for Concurrent Noninterference
papers.authors: Aslan Askarov, Stephen Chong, Heiko Mantel
papers.abstract: Controlling confidential information in concurrent systems is difficult, due to covert channels resulting from interaction between threads. This problem is exacerbated if threads share resources at fine granularity. In this work, we propose a novel monitoring framework to enforce strong information security in concurrent programs. Our monitors are hybrid, combining dynamic and static program analysis to enforce security in a sound and rather precise fashion. In our framework, each thread is guarded by its own local monitor, and there is a single global monitor. We instantiate our monitoring framework to support rely-guarantee style reasoning about the use of shared resources, at the granularity of individual memory locations, and then specialize local monitors further to enforce flow-sensitive progress-sensitive information-flow control. Our local monitors exploit rely-guarantee-style reasoning about shared memory to achieve high precision. Soundness of rely-guarantee-style reasoning is guaranteed by all monitors cooperatively. The global monitor is invoked only when threads synchronize, and so does not needlessly restrict concurrency. We prove that our hybrid monitoring approach enforces a knowledge-based progress-sensitive non-interference security condition.
papers.abstract_zh: 在并发系统中控制机密信息是困难的，因为线程之间的交互会产生隐蔽通道。如果线程在细粒度上共享资源，这个问题会更加严重。在这篇文章中，我们提出了一个新的监控框架来加强并发程序中的信息安全。我们的监视器是混合型的，结合了动态和静态程序分析，以一种可靠且相当精确的方式来加强安全性。在我们的框架中，每个线程都由自己的本地监视器保护，并且只有一个全局监视器。我们实例化了我们的监控框架，以支持在单个内存位置的粒度上对共享资源的使用进行可靠保证式的推理，然后进一步专门化本地监控器，以加强对流敏感的、对进度敏感的信息流控制。我们的本地监视器利用关于共享内存的可靠保证式推理来实现高精度。可靠保证式推理的可靠性由所有监控器协同保证。全局监视器仅在线程同步时调用，因此不会不必要地限制并发性。我们证明了我们的混合监控方法实施了基于知识的进度敏感的无干扰安全条件。
papers.title_zh: 并行无干扰混合监控器

papers.title: Du-Vote: Remote Electronic Voting with Untrusted Computers
papers.authors: Gurchetan S. Grewal, Mark Dermot Ryan, Liqun Chen, Michael R. Clarkson
papers.abstract: Du-Vote is a new remote electronic voting protocol that eliminates the often-required assumption that voters trust general-purpose computers. Trust is distributed in Du-Vote between a simple hardware token issued to the voter, the voter's computer, and a server run by election authorities. Verifiability is guaranteed with high probability even if all these machines are controlled by the adversary, and privacy is guaranteed as long as at least either the voter's computer, or the server and the hardware token, are not controlled by the adversary. The design of the Du-Vote protocol is presented in this paper. A new non-interactive zero-knowledge proof is employed to verify the server's computations. Du-Vote is a step towards tackling the problem of internet voting on user machines that are likely to have malware. We anticipate that the methods of Du-Vote can be used in other applications to find ways of achieving malware tolerance, that is, ways of securely using platforms that are known or suspected to have malware.
papers.abstract_zh: Du-Vote是一种新的远程电子投票协议，它消除了投票者信任通用计算机这一经常需要的假设。在Du-Vote中，信任分布在颁发给投票人的简单硬件令牌、投票人的计算机和由选举机构运行的服务器之间。即使所有这些机器都被对手控制，也很有可能保证可验证性，并且只要至少投票人的计算机或者服务器和硬件令牌不被对手控制，就可以保证隐私。本文介绍了Du-Vote协议的设计。采用一种新的非交互式零知识证明来验证服务器的计算。Du-Vote是解决用户机器上可能有恶意软件的互联网投票问题的一个步骤。我们预计Du-Vote的方法可以在其他应用程序中使用，以找到实现恶意软件容忍的方法，即安全使用已知或怀疑有恶意软件的平台的方法。
papers.title_zh: Du-Vote:使用不可信计算机的远程电子投票

papers.title: Decidability of Trace Equivalence for Protocols with Nonces
papers.authors: Rémy Chrétien, Véronique Cortier, Stéphanie Delaune
papers.abstract: Privacy properties such as anonymity, unlink ability, or vote secrecy are typically expressed as equivalence properties. In this paper, we provide the first decidability result for trace equivalence of security protocols, for an unbounded number of sessions and unlimited fresh nonce's. Our class encompasses most symmetric key protocols of the literature, in their tagged variant.
papers.abstract_zh: 匿名性、不可链接性或投票保密性等隐私属性通常被表示为等价属性。在本文中，我们提供了安全协议的迹等价的第一个可判定性结果，对于无限数量的会话和无限的新鲜随机数。我们的类包含了文献中大多数的对称密钥协议，以它们的标签形式。
papers.title_zh: 具有随机数的协议的迹等价的可判定性

papers.title: Set-Pi: Set Membership p-Calculus
papers.authors: Alessandro Bruni, Sebastian Mödersheim, Flemming Nielson, Hanne Riis Nielson
papers.abstract: Communication protocols often rely on stateful mechanisms to ensure certain security properties. For example, counters and timestamps can be used to ensure authentication, or the security of communication can depend on whether a particular key is registered to a server or it has been revoked. ProVerif, like other state of the art tools for protocol analysis, achieves good performance by converting a formal protocol specification into a set of Horn clauses, that represent a monotonically growing set of facts that a Dolev-Yao attacker can derive from the system. Since this set of facts is not state-dependent, the category of protocols of our interest cannot be precisely analysed by such tools, as they would report false attacks due to the over-approximation. In this paper we present Set-π, an extension of the Applied π-calculus that includes primitives for handling databases of objects, and propose a translation from Set-π into Horn clauses that employs the set-membership abstraction to capture the non-monotonicity of the state. Furthermore, we give a characterisation of authentication properties in terms of the set properties in the language, and prove the correctness of our approach. Finally we showcase our method with three examples, a simple authentication protocol based on counters, a key registration protocol, and a model of the Yubikey security device.
papers.abstract_zh: 通信协议通常依赖有状态机制来确保某些安全属性。例如，可以使用计数器和时间戳来确保身份验证，或者通信的安全性可以取决于特定密钥是注册到服务器还是已经被撤销。与其他先进的协议分析工具一样，ProVerif通过将正式的协议规范转换为一组Horn子句来实现良好的性能，这些Horn子句表示Dolev-Yao攻击者可以从系统中获得的一组单调增长的事实。由于这组事实不依赖于状态，我们感兴趣的协议类别不能被这样的工具精确地分析，因为它们会由于过度近似而报告错误的攻击。在本文中，我们提出了Set-π，它是应用π演算的扩展，包括用于处理对象数据库的原语，并提出了从Set-π到Horn子句的转换，该转换使用集合成员抽象来捕获状态的非单调性。此外，我们根据语言中的集合属性给出了认证属性的特征，并证明了我们方法的正确性。最后我们用三个例子来展示我们的方法，一个简单的基于计数器的认证协议，一个密钥注册协议和一个Yubikey安全设备的模型。
papers.title_zh: Set-Pi:集员p-演算

papers.title: A Complete Characterization of Secure Human-Server Communication
papers.authors: David A. Basin, Sasa Radomirovic, Michael Schläpfer
papers.abstract: Establishing a secure communication channel between two parties is a nontrivial problem, especially when one or both are humans. Unlike computers, humans cannot perform strong cryptographic operations without supporting technology, yet this technology may itself be compromised. We introduce a general communication topology model to facilitate the analysis of security protocols in this setting. We use it to completely characterize all topologies that allow secure communication between a human and a remote server via a compromised computer. These topologies are relevant for a variety of applications, including online banking and Internet voting. Our characterization can serve to guide the design of novel solutions for applications and to quickly exclude proposals that cannot possibly offer secure communication.
papers.abstract_zh: 在两方之间建立安全的通信通道是一个不小的问题，尤其是当一方或双方都是人类时。与计算机不同，人类无法在没有技术支持的情况下执行强大的加密操作，然而这项技术本身可能会受到损害。我们引入了一个通用的通信拓扑模型，以便于在这种环境下分析安全协议。我们使用它来完整地描述所有拓扑结构的特征，这些拓扑结构允许一个人和一个远程服务器通过一台被入侵的计算机进行安全通信。这些拓扑与各种应用相关，包括在线银行和互联网投票。我们的特征可用于指导应用的新型解决方案的设计，并快速排除不可能提供安全通信的方案。
papers.title_zh: 安全人机通信的完整描述

papers.title: A Definitional Framework for Functional Encryption
papers.authors: Christian Matt, Ueli Maurer
papers.abstract: Functional encryption (FE) is a powerful generalization of various types of encryption. We investigate how FE can be used by a trusted authority to enforce access-control policies to data stored in an untrusted repository. Intuitively, if (functionally) encrypted data items are put in a publicly-readable repository, the effect of the encryption should be that every user has access to exactly (and only) those functions of the data items for which he has previously received the corresponding decryption key. That is, in an ideal-world view, the key authority can flexibly manage read access of users to the repository. This appears to be exactly what FE is supposed to achieve, and most natural applications of FE can be understood as specific uses of such a repository with access control. However, quite surprisingly, it is unclear whether known security definitions actually achieve this goal and hence whether known FE schemes can be used in such an application. In fact, there seems to be agreement in the cryptographic community that identifying the right security definitions for FE remains open. To resolve this problem, we treat FE in the constructive cryptography framework and propose a new conventional security definition, called composable functional encryption security (CFE-security), which exactly matches the described ideal-world interpretation. This definition (and hence the described application) is shown to be unachievable in the standard model but achievable in the random oracle model. Moreover, somewhat weaker definitions, which are achievable in the standard model, can be obtained by certain operational restrictions of the ideal-world repository, making explicit how schemes satisfying such a definition can (and cannot) meaningfully be used. Finally, adequate security definitions for generalizations of FE (such as multi-input, randomized functions, malicious cipher text generation, etc.) can be obtained by straight-forward operational extensions of the repository and extracting the corresponding security definitions. This leads towards a unified treatment of the security of FE.
papers.abstract_zh: 功能加密(FE)是各种类型加密的强大概括。我们研究了可信机构如何使用FE对存储在不可信存储库中的数据实施访问控制策略。直观地说，如果(功能上)加密的数据项被放在公共可读的储存库中，加密的效果应该是每个用户都可以准确地(且仅)访问他先前已经接收到相应解密密钥的数据项的那些功能。也就是说，在理想情况下，密钥管理机构可以灵活地管理用户对存储库的读取访问。这似乎正是FE应该实现的，FE的大多数自然应用可以理解为这种带有访问控制的存储库的特定用途。然而，非常令人惊讶的是，不清楚已知的安全定义是否实际上实现了这个目标，因此不清楚已知的FE方案是否可以用于这样的应用。事实上，在加密社区中似乎有一个共识，即确定FE的正确安全定义仍然是开放的。为了解决这个问题，我们在构造性密码框架中处理FE，并提出了一个新的传统安全定义，称为可组合函数加密安全(CFE-security ),它与所描述的理想世界解释完全匹配。这个定义(以及所描述的应用程序)在标准模型中是无法实现的，但在随机预言模型中是可以实现的。此外，在标准模型中可以实现的稍微弱一些的定义，可以通过理想世界存储库的某些操作限制来获得，从而明确如何能够(和不能够)有意义地使用满足这种定义的方案。最后，对FE的泛化(如多输入、随机化函数、恶意密文生成等)进行充分的安全定义。)可以通过对存储库的直接操作扩展和提取相应的安全性定义来获得。这导致对FE安全性的统一处理。
papers.title_zh: 一个函数加密的定义框架

papers.title: Reasoning about Policy Behavior in Logic-Based Trust Management Systems: Some Complexity Results and an Operational Framework
papers.authors: Edelmira Pasarella, Jorge Lobo
papers.abstract: In this paper we show that the logical framework proposed by Becker et al. [1] to reason about security policy behavior in a trust management context can be captured by an operational framework that is based on the language proposed by Miller in 1989 to deal with scoping and/or modules in logic programming. The framework of Becker et al. uses propositional Horn clauses to represent both policies and credentials, implications in clauses are interpreted in counterfactual logic, a Hilbert-style proof system is defined and a system based on SAT is used to prove whether properties about credentials, permissions and policies are valid, i.e. true under all possible policies. Our contributions in this paper are three. First, we show that this kind of validation can rely on an operational semantics (derivability relation) of a language very similar to Miller's language, which is very close to derivability in logic programs. Second, we are able to establish that, as in propositional logic, validity of formulas is a co-NP-complete problem. And third, we present a provably correct implementation of a goal-oriented algorithm for validity.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们展示了Becker等人[1]提出的用于推理信任管理上下文中的安全策略行为的逻辑框架可以被基于Miller在1989年提出的用于处理逻辑编程中的作用域和/或模块的语言的操作框架捕获。Becker等人的框架使用命题Horn子句来表示策略和凭证，子句中的含义以反事实逻辑来解释，定义了Hilbert类型的证明系统，并使用基于SAT的系统来证明关于凭证、权限和策略的属性是否有效，即在所有可能的策略下都是真实的。本文的贡献有三。首先，我们表明这种验证可以依赖于与米勒语言非常相似的语言的操作语义(可导性关系)，这与逻辑程序中的可导性非常接近。第二，我们能够确定，如同在命题逻辑中一样，公式的有效性是一个共NP完全问题。第三，我们提出了一个可证明正确的面向目标的算法实现的有效性。
papers.title_zh: 基于逻辑的信任管理系统中策略行为的推理:一些复杂性结果和一个操作框架

papers.title: Picking vs. Guessing Secrets: A Game-Theoretic Analysis
papers.authors: M. H. R. Khouzani, Piotr Mardziel, Carlos Cid, Mudhakar Srivatsa
papers.abstract: Choosing a hard-to-guess secret is a prerequisite in many security applications. Whether it is a password for user authentication or a secret key for a cryptographic primitive, picking it requires the user to trade-off usability costs with resistance against an adversary: a simple password is easier to remember but is also easier to guess, likewise, a shorter cryptographic key may require fewer computational and storage resources but it is also easier to attack. A fundamental question is how one can optimally resolve this trade-off. A big challenge is the fact that an adversary can also utilize the knowledge of such usability vs. security trade-offs to strengthen its attack. In this paper, we propose a game-theoretic framework for analyzing the optimal trade-offs in the face of strategic adversaries. We consider two types of adversaries: those limited in their number of tries, and those that are ruled by the cost of making individual guesses. For each type, we derive the mutually-optimal decisions as Nash Equilibria, the strategically pessimistic decisions as maximin, and optimal commitments as Strong Stackelberg Equilibria of the game. We establish that when the adversaries are faced with a capped number of guesses, the user's optimal trade-off is a uniform randomization over a subset of the secret domain. On the other hand, when the attacker strategy is ruled by the cost of making individual guesses, Nash Equilibria may completely fail to provide the user with any level of security, signifying the crucial role of credible commitment for such cases. We illustrate our results using numerical examples based on real-world samples and discuss some policy implications of our work.
papers.abstract_zh: 选择一个难以猜测的秘密是许多安全应用程序的先决条件。无论它是用于用户认证的密码还是用于加密原语的密钥，选择它都需要用户在可用性成本和对抗对手的能力之间进行权衡:简单的密码更容易记住，但也更容易猜测，同样，较短的加密密钥可能需要较少的计算和存储资源，但也更容易被攻击。一个根本的问题是，我们如何能够最佳地解决这种权衡。一个巨大的挑战是，对手也可以利用这种可用性与安全性权衡的知识来加强其攻击。在本文中，我们提出了一个博弈论框架，用于分析面对战略对手时的最佳权衡。我们考虑两种类型的对手:一种是尝试次数有限的对手，另一种是被单独猜测的成本所控制的对手。对于每一种类型，我们得出相互最优的决策作为纳什均衡，战略上悲观的决策作为马希民，最优承诺作为博弈的强斯塔克尔伯格均衡。我们证明，当对手面对数量有限的猜测时，用户的最佳权衡是在秘密域的子集上均匀随机化。另一方面，当攻击者的策略受个人猜测成本的支配时，纳什均衡可能完全无法为用户提供任何级别的安全性，这表明了可信承诺在这种情况下的关键作用。我们用基于真实世界样本的数值例子说明了我们的结果，并讨论了我们工作的一些政策含义。
papers.title_zh: 挑选与猜测秘密:博弈论分析

papers.title: Program Actions as Actual Causes: A Building Block for Accountability
papers.authors: Anupam Datta, Deepak Garg, Dilsun Kirli Kaynar, Divya Sharma, Arunesh Sinha
papers.abstract: Protocols for tasks such as authentication, electronic voting, and secure multiparty computation ensure desirable security properties if agents follow their prescribed programs. However, if some agents deviate from their prescribed programs and a security property is violated, it is important to hold agents accountable by determining which deviations actually caused the violation. Motivated by these applications, we initiate a formal study of program actions as actual causes. Specifically, we define in an interacting program model what it means for a set of program actions to be an actual cause of a violation. We present a sound technique for establishing program actions as actual causes. We demonstrate the value of this formalism in two ways. First, we prove that violations of a specific class of safety properties always have an actual cause. Thus, our definition applies to relevant security properties. Second, we provide a cause analysis of a representative protocol designed to address weaknesses in the current public key certification infrastructure.
papers.abstract_zh: 如果代理遵循他们规定的程序，用于诸如认证、电子投票和安全多方计算之类的任务的协议确保了期望的安全属性。但是，如果一些代理偏离了他们规定的程序，并且违反了安全属性，那么通过确定哪些偏离实际上导致了违规来追究代理的责任是很重要的。在这些应用的推动下，我们开始了对程序行为作为实际原因的正式研究。具体来说，我们在一个交互程序模型中定义了一组程序动作作为违规的实际原因意味着什么。我们提出了一个合理的技术来建立程序行为作为实际原因。我们从两个方面证明了这种形式主义的价值。首先，我们证明违反特定类别的安全属性总是有一个实际的原因。因此，我们的定义适用于相关的安全属性。其次，我们提供了一个代表性协议的原因分析，该协议旨在解决当前公钥认证基础设施中的弱点。
papers.title_zh: 作为实际原因的计划行动:问责制的基石

papers.title: BitWhisper: Covert Signaling Channel between Air-Gapped Computers Using Thermal Manipulations
papers.authors: Mordechai Guri, Matan Monitz, Yisroel Mirski, Yuval Elovici
papers.abstract: It has been assumed that the physical separation ('air-gap') of computers provides a reliable level of security, such that should two adjacent computers become compromised, the covert exchange of data between them would be impossible. In this paper, we demonstrate BitWhisper, a method of bridging the air-gap between adjacent compromised computers by using their heat emissions and built-in thermal sensors to create a covert communication channel. Our method is unique in two respects: it supports bidirectional communication, and it requires no additional dedicated peripheral hardware. We provide experimental results based on the implementation of the Bit-Whisper prototype, and examine the channel's properties and limitations. Our experiments included different layouts, with computers positioned at varying distances from one another, and several sensor types and CPU configurations (e.g., Virtual Machines). We also discuss signal modulation and communication protocols, showing how BitWhisper can be used for the exchange of data between two computers in a close proximity (positioned 0-40 cm apart) at an effective rate of 1-8 bits per hour, a rate which makes it possible to infiltrate brief commands and exfiltrate small amount of data (e.g., passwords) over the covert channel.
papers.abstract_zh: 已经假定计算机的物理隔离(“空气间隙”)提供了可靠的安全级别，使得如果两台相邻的计算机受到危害，它们之间的数据秘密交换将是不可能的。在本文中，我们演示了BitWhisper，这是一种通过使用相邻受攻击计算机的热辐射和内置热传感器来创建隐蔽通信通道，从而桥接相邻受攻击计算机之间空气间隙的方法。我们的方法在两个方面是独特的:它支持双向通信，并且它不需要额外的专用外围硬件。我们提供了基于比特耳语原型实现的实验结果，并检查了信道的属性和限制。我们的实验包括不同的布局，计算机之间的距离不同，以及几种传感器类型和CPU配置(例如，虚拟机)。我们还讨论了信号调制和通信协议，展示了如何使用BitWhisper在两台距离很近的计算机(相距0-40厘米)之间以每小时1-8位的有效速率交换数据，这种速率使得有可能通过隐蔽通道渗透简短的命令和泄漏少量数据(例如密码)。
papers.title_zh: BitWhisper:利用热操纵在气隙计算机之间建立隐蔽的信号通道

papers.title: A Parametric Family of Attack Models for Proxy Re-encryption
papers.authors: David Nuñez, Isaac Agudo, Javier López
papers.abstract: Proxy Re-Encryption (PRE) is a type of Public-Key Encryption (PKE) that provides an additional re-encryption functionality. Although PRE is inherently more complex than PKE, attack models for PRE have not been developed further than those inherited from PKE. In this paper we address this gap and define a parametric family of attack models for PRE, based on the availability of both the decryption and re-encryption oracles during the security game. This family enables the definition of a set of intermediate security notions for PRE that ranges from "plain" IND-CPA to "full" IND-CCA. We analyze some relations among these notions of security, and in particular, the separations that arise when the re-encryption oracle leaks re-encryption keys. In addition, we discuss which of these security notions represent meaningful adversarial models for PRE. Finally, we provide an example of a recent "CCA1-secure" scheme from PKC 2014 whose security model does not capture chosen-cipher text attacks through re-encryption and for which we describe an attack under a more realistic security notion. This attack emphasizes the fact that PRE schemes that leak re-encryption keys cannot achieve strong security notions.
papers.abstract_zh: 代理重新加密(PRE)是一种公钥加密(PKE ),它提供了额外的重新加密功能。虽然PRE本质上比PKE更复杂，但PRE的攻击模型并没有比从PKE继承的模型发展得更好。在本文中，我们解决了这个问题，并基于安全游戏中解密和重新加密预言的可用性，定义了PRE攻击模型的参数族。该系列支持PRE的一组中间安全概念的定义，范围从“简单的”IND-CPA到“完整的”IND-CCA。我们分析了这些安全概念之间的一些关系，特别是当重新加密oracle泄漏重新加密密钥时出现的分离。此外，我们还讨论了这些安全概念中的哪些代表了PRE的有意义的对抗模型。最后，我们提供了一个最近来自PKC 2014的“CCA1-secure”方案的示例，其安全模型不通过重新加密来捕获选择密文攻击，我们在更现实的安全概念下描述了针对该方案的攻击。这种攻击强调了这样一个事实，即泄漏重新加密密钥的PRE方案不能实现强安全概念。
papers.title_zh: 代理重加密的参数攻击模型族

papers.title: A Hybrid Approach for Proving Noninterference of Java Programs
papers.authors: Ralf Küsters, Tomasz Truderung, Bernhard Beckert, Daniel Bruns, Michael Kirsten, Martin Mohr
papers.abstract: Several tools and approaches for proving non-interference properties for Java and other languages exist. Some of them have a high degree of automation or are even fully automatic, but over approximate the actual information flow, and hence, may produce false positives. Other tools, such as those based on theorem proving, are precise, but may need interaction, and hence, analysis is time-consuming. In this paper, we propose a hybrid approach that aims at obtaining the best of both approaches: We want to use fully automatic analysis as much as possible and only at places in a program where, due to over approximation, the automatic approaches fail, we resort to more precise, but interactive analysis, where the latter involves the verification only of specific functional properties in certain parts of the program, rather than checking more intricate non-interference properties for the whole program. To illustrate the hybrid approach, in a case study we use this approach - along with the fully automatic tool Joana for checking non-interference properties for Java programs and the theorem prover KeY for the verification of Java programs - as well as the CVJ framework proposed by Kuesters, Truderung, and Graf to establish cryptographic privacy properties for a non-trivial Java program, namely an e-voting system. The CVJ framework allows one to establish cryptographic indistinguishability properties for Java programs by checking (standard) non-interference properties for such programs.
papers.abstract_zh: 有几种工具和方法可以证明Java和其他语言的无干扰特性。其中一些自动化程度很高，甚至是全自动的，但过于接近实际的信息流，因此可能会产生误报。其他工具，如基于定理证明的工具，虽然精确，但可能需要交互，因此分析非常耗时。在本文中，我们提出了一种混合方法，旨在获得这两种方法的最佳效果:我们希望尽可能多地使用全自动分析，并且仅在程序中由于过度近似而导致自动方法失败的地方，我们求助于更精确但交互式的分析，其中后者仅涉及验证程序的某些部分中的特定功能属性，而不是检查整个程序的更复杂的非干扰属性。为了说明这种混合方法，在一个案例研究中，我们使用这种方法——与用于检查Java程序的无干扰属性的全自动工具Joana和用于验证Java程序的定理证明器密钥一起——以及由Kuesters、Truderung和Graf提出的CVJ框架来为一个重要的Java程序(即电子投票系统)建立加密隐私属性。CVJ框架允许人们通过检查Java程序的(标准)无干扰特性来建立这种程序的密码不可区分性特性。
papers.title_zh: 一种证明Java程序互不干扰的混合方法

papers.title: Android Permissions Unleashed
papers.authors: Alessandro Armando, Roberto Carbone, Gabriele Costa, Alessio Merlo
papers.abstract: The Android Security Framework controls the executions of applications through permissions which are statically granted by the user during installation. However, the definition of security policies over permissions is not supported. Security policies must be therefore manually encoded into the application by the developer, which is a dangerous practice and may cause security breaches. We propose an improvement over the Android permission system that supports the specification and enforcement of fine-grained security policies. Enforcement is achieved by reducing policy decision problems to propositional satisfiability and leveraging a state-of-the-art SAT solver. Unlike alternative proposals, our approach does not require changes in the operating system and, therefore, it can be readily deployed in any commercial device.
papers.abstract_zh: Android安全框架通过用户在安装期间静态授予的权限来控制应用程序的执行。但是，不支持权限安全策略的定义。因此，安全策略必须由开发人员手动编码到应用程序中，这是一种危险的做法，可能会导致安全漏洞。我们提出了对Android权限系统的改进，支持细粒度安全策略的规范和实施。通过将政策决策问题简化为命题可满足性并利用最先进的SAT求解器来实现实施。与替代方案不同，我们的方法不需要改变操作系统，因此，它可以很容易地部署在任何商业设备中。
papers.title_zh: 释放安卓权限

papers.title: Cryptographic Enforcement of Language-Based Information Erasure
papers.authors: Aslan Askarov, Scott Moore, Christos Dimoulas, Stephen Chong
papers.abstract: Information erasure is a formal security requirement that stipulates when sensitive data must be removed from computer systems. In a system that correctly enforces erasure requirements, an attacker who observes the system after sensitive data is required to have been erased cannot deduce anything about the data. Practical obstacles to enforcing information erasure include: (1) correctly determining which data requires erasure, and (2) reliably deleting potentially large volumes of data, despite untrustworthy storage services. In this paper, we present a novel formalization of language-based information erasure that supports cryptographic enforcement of erasure requirements: sensitive data is encrypted before storage, and upon erasure, only a relatively small set of decryption keys needs to be deleted. This cryptographic technique has been used by a number of systems that implement data deletion to allow the use of untrustworthy storage services. However, these systems provide no support to correctly determine which data requires erasure, nor have the formal semantic properties of these systems been explained or proven to hold. We address these shortcomings. Specifically, we study a programming language extended with primitives for public-key cryptography, and demonstrate how information-flow control mechanisms can automatically track data that requires erasure and provably enforce erasure requirements even when programs employ cryptographic techniques for erasure.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息擦除是一项正式的安全要求，规定了何时必须从计算机系统中删除敏感数据。在正确实施擦除要求的系统中，在敏感数据被要求已经被擦除之后观察系统的攻击者不能推断出关于数据的任何事情。实施信息擦除的实际障碍包括:(1)正确确定哪些数据需要擦除，以及(2)可靠地删除潜在的大量数据，尽管存储服务不可信。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的基于语言的信息擦除形式化方法，它支持擦除需求的加密实施:敏感数据在存储之前被加密，并且在擦除时，只需要删除相对较小的解密密钥集。这种加密技术已经被许多实现数据删除的系统使用，以允许使用不可信的存储服务。然而，这些系统不支持正确确定哪些数据需要擦除，也没有解释或证明这些系统的正式语义属性成立。我们解决这些缺点。具体来说，我们研究了一种扩展了公钥加密原语的编程语言，并演示了信息流控制机制如何自动跟踪需要擦除的数据，并且即使在程序使用加密技术进行擦除时，也可以证明强制执行擦除要求。
papers.title_zh: 基于语言的信息擦除的加密实施

papers.title: Value-Sensitive Hybrid Information Flow Control for a JavaScript-Like Language
papers.authors: Daniel Hedin, Luciano Bello, Andrei Sabelfeld
papers.abstract: Secure integration of third-party code is one of the prime challenges for securing today's web. Recent empirical studies give evidence of pervasive reliance on and excessive trust in third-party JavaScript, with no adequate security mechanism to limit the trust or the extent of its abuse. Information flow control is a promising approach for controlling the behavior of third-party code and enforcing confidentiality and integrity policies. While much progress has been made on static and dynamic approaches to information flow control, only recently their combinations have received attention. Purely static analysis falls short of addressing dynamic language features such as dynamic objects and dynamic code evaluation, while purely dynamic analysis suffers from inability to predict side effects in non-performed executions. This paper develops a value-sensitive hybrid mechanism for tracking information flow in a JavaScript-like language. The mechanism consists of a dynamic monitor empowered to invoke a static component on the fly. This enables us to achieve a sound yet permissive enforcement. We establish formal soundness results with respect to the security policy of non-interference. In addition, we demonstrate permissiveness by proving that we subsume the precision of purely static analysis and by presenting a collection of common programming patterns that indicate that our mechanism has potential to provide more permissiveness than dynamic mechanisms in practice.
papers.abstract_zh: 第三方代码的安全集成是保护当今网络的主要挑战之一。最近的实证研究提供了对第三方JavaScript的普遍依赖和过度信任的证据，而没有足够的安全机制来限制这种信任或其滥用的程度。信息流控制是控制第三方代码行为和实施机密性和完整性策略的一种有前途的方法。虽然在信息流控制的静态和动态方法方面已经取得了很大进展，但是直到最近它们的结合才受到关注。纯静态分析无法处理动态语言特性，如动态对象和动态代码评估，而纯动态分析则无法预测未执行的执行中的副作用。本文开发了一种值敏感的混合机制，用于跟踪类JavaScript语言中的信息流。该机制由一个动态监视器组成，它能够动态调用静态组件。这使我们能够实现健全而宽容的执法。我们建立了关于不干涉安全策略的形式合理性结果。此外，我们通过证明我们包含了纯静态分析的精度，并通过展示一组公共编程模式表明我们的机制在实践中有可能提供比动态机制更多的允许性，来展示允许性。
papers.title_zh: 用于类JavaScript语言的值敏感混合信息流控制

papers.title: Information Flow Control for Event Handling and the DOM in Web Browsers
papers.authors: Vineet Rajani, Abhishek Bichhawat, Deepak Garg, Christian Hammer
papers.abstract: Web browsers routinely handle private information. Owing to a lax security model, browsers and JavaScript in particular, are easy targets for leaking sensitive data. Prior work has extensively studied information flow control (IFC) as a mechanism for securing browsers. However, two central aspects of web browsers - the Document Object Model (DOM) and the event handling mechanism - have so far evaded thorough scrutiny in the context of IFC. This paper advances the state-of-the-art in this regard. Based on standard specifications and the code of an actual browser engine, we build formal models of both the DOM (up to Level 3) and the event handling loop of a typical browser, enhance the models with fine-grained taints and checks for IFC, prove our enhancements sound and test our ideas through an instrumentation of WebKit, an in-production browser engine. In doing so, we observe several channels for information leak that arise due to subtleties of the event loop and its interaction with the DOM.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络浏览器通常会处理私人信息。由于松散的安全模型，浏览器尤其是JavaScript很容易成为泄露敏感数据的目标。先前的工作已经广泛地研究了信息流控制(IFC)作为保护浏览器的机制。然而，web浏览器的两个核心方面——文档对象模型(DOM)和事件处理机制——迄今为止还没有在IFC的上下文中进行彻底的审查。本文介绍了这方面的最新进展。基于标准规范和实际浏览器引擎的代码，我们构建了典型浏览器的DOM(直到第3级)和事件处理循环的正式模型，使用细粒度污点和IFC检查增强了模型，证明了我们的增强功能是可靠的，并通过WebKit(一个生产中的浏览器引擎)测试了我们的想法。在这样做的过程中，我们观察到由于事件循环及其与DOM的交互的微妙性而导致的信息泄漏的几个渠道。
papers.title_zh: Web浏览器中事件处理和DOM的信息流控制

papers.title: An Analysis of Universal Information Flow Based on Self-Composition
papers.authors: Christian Müller, Máté Kovács, Helmut Seidl
papers.abstract: We introduce a novel way of proving information flow properties of a program based on its self-composition. Similarly to the universal information flow type system of Hunt and Sands, our analysis explicitly computes the dependencies of variables in the final state on variables in the initial state. Accordingly, the analysis result is independent of specific information flow lattices, and allows to derive information flow w.r.t. any of these. While our analysis runs in polynomial time, we prove that it never loses precision against the type system of Hunt and Sands, and may gain extra precision by taking similarities between different branches of conditionals into account. Also, we indicate how it can be smoothly generalized to an interprocedural analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们介绍了一种基于程序自组合来证明程序信息流性质的新方法。类似于Hunt和Sands的通用信息流类型系统，我们的分析明确地计算了最终状态变量对初始状态变量的依赖性。因此，分析结果独立于特定的信息流格，并允许根据这些格中的任何一个导出信息流。虽然我们的分析是在多项式时间内运行的，但我们证明，相对于Hunt和Sands的类型系统，它不会失去精度，并且通过考虑不同条件分支之间的相似性，可以获得额外的精度。此外，我们指出它如何能够顺利推广到过程间分析。
papers.title_zh: 基于自组装的通用信息流分析

papers.title: On Power Splitting Games in Distributed Computation: The Case of Bitcoin Pooled Mining
papers.authors: Loi Luu, Ratul Saha, Inian Parameshwaran, Prateek Saxena, Aquinas Hobor
papers.abstract: Several new services incentivize clients to compete in solving large computation tasks in exchange for financial rewards. This model of competitive distributed computation enables every user connected to the Internet to participate in a game in which he splits his computational power among a set of competing pools -- the game is called a computational power splitting game. We formally model this game and show its utility in analyzing the security of pool protocols that dictate how financial rewards are shared among the members of a pool. As a case study, we analyze the Bitcoin crypto currency which attracts computing power roughly equivalent to billions of desktop machines, over 70% of which is organized into public pools. We show that existing pool reward sharing protocols are insecure in our game-theoretic analysis under an attack strategy called the "block withholding attack". This attack is a topic of debate, initially thought to be ill-incentivized in today's pool protocols: i.e., causing a net loss to the attacker, and later argued to be always profitable. Our analysis shows that the attack is always well-incentivized in the long-run, but may not be so for a short duration. This implies that existing pool protocols are insecure, and if the attack is conducted systematically, Bitcoin pools could lose millions of dollars worth in months. The equilibrium state is a mixed strategy -- that is -- in equilibrium all clients are incentivized to probabilistically attack to maximize their payoffs rather than participate honestly. As a result, the Bitcoin network is incentivized to waste a part of its resources simply to compete.
papers.abstract_zh: 几项新服务激励客户参与解决大型计算任务的竞争，以换取经济回报。这种竞争性分布式计算模型使连接到互联网的每个用户都能够参与一个游戏，在这个游戏中，他在一组竞争性的池中分配他的计算能力——这个游戏被称为计算能力分配游戏。我们正式建立了这个游戏的模型，并展示了它在分析池协议的安全性方面的效用，这些协议规定了如何在池成员之间共享财务奖励。作为一个案例研究，我们分析了比特币加密货币，它吸引的计算能力大约相当于数十亿台台式机，其中70%以上被组织到公共池中。在我们的博弈论分析中，我们证明了现有的共享奖励协议在被称为“阻止攻击”的攻击策略下是不安全的。这种攻击是一个有争议的话题，最初被认为是当今池协议中的不良激励:即，给攻击者造成净损失，后来被认为总是有利可图。我们的分析表明，从长期来看，攻击总是受到很好的激励，但在短期内可能不会如此。这意味着现有的池协议是不安全的，如果攻击是系统性的，比特币池可能在几个月内损失数百万美元。均衡状态是一种混合策略，也就是说，在均衡状态下，所有客户都被激励进行概率攻击，以最大化他们的收益，而不是诚实地参与。其结果是，比特币网络受到激励，为了竞争而浪费一部分资源。
papers.title_zh: 分布式计算中的权力分割博弈——以比特币池挖掘为例

papers.title: Symbolic Malleable Zero-Knowledge Proofs
papers.authors: Michael Backes, Fabian Bendun, Matteo Maffei, Esfandiar Mohammadi, Kim Pecina
papers.abstract: Zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs have become a central building block for a variety of modern security protocols. Modern ZK constructions, such as the Groth-Sahai proof system, offer novel types of cryptographic flexibility: a participant is able to re-randomize existing ZK proofs to achieve, for instance, message unlink ability in anonymity protocols, she can hide public parts of a ZK proof statement to meet her specific privacy requirements, and she can logically compose ZK proofs in order to construct new proof statements. ZK proof systems that permit these transformations are called malleable. However, since these transformations are accessible also to the adversary, analyzing the security of these protocols requires one to cope with a much more comprehensive attacker model -- a challenge that automated protocol analysis thus far has not been capable of dealing with. In this work, we introduce the first symbolic abstraction of malleable ZK proofs. We further prove the computational soundness of our abstraction with respect to observational equivalence, which enables the computationally sound verification of privacy properties. Finally, we show that our symbolic abstraction is suitable for ProVerif, a state-of-the-art cryptographic protocol verifier, by verifying an improved version of the anonymous webs of trust protocol.
papers.abstract_zh: 零知识(ZK)证明已经成为各种现代安全协议的核心构件。现代ZK构造，如Groth-Sahai证明系统，提供了新型的加密灵活性:参与者能够重新随机化现有的ZK证明，以实现匿名协议中的消息解除链接能力，她可以隐藏ZK证明语句的公共部分，以满足她的特定隐私要求，并且她可以逻辑地组成ZK证明，以构造新的证明语句。允许这些变换的ZK证明系统被称为可塑的。然而，由于对手也可以访问这些转换，因此分析这些协议的安全性需要应对更全面的攻击者模型，这是自动化协议分析迄今为止还无法应对的挑战。在这项工作中，我们介绍了第一个符号抽象的可塑性ZK证明。我们进一步证明了我们的抽象关于观测等价的计算可靠性，这使得隐私属性的计算可靠性验证成为可能。最后，通过验证匿名信任网协议的改进版本，我们证明了我们的符号抽象适用于ProVerif，一个最先进的密码协议验证器。
papers.title_zh: 符号可延展零知识证明

papers.title: A Mechanized Proof of Security for Searchable Symmetric Encryption
papers.authors: Adam Petcher, Greg Morrisett
papers.abstract: We present a mechanized proof of security for an efficient Searchable Symmetric Encryption (SSE) scheme completed in the Foundational Cryptography Framework (FCF). FCF is a Coq library for reasoning about cryptographic schemes in the computational model that features a small trusted computing base and an extensible design. Through this effort, we provide the first mechanized proof of security for an efficient SSE scheme, and we demonstrate that FCF is well-suited to reasoning about such complex protocols.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个在基础密码学框架(FCF)中完成的高效可搜索对称加密(SSE)方案的安全性的机械化证明。FCF是一个Coq库，用于对计算模型中的加密方案进行推理，具有小型可信计算基础和可扩展设计。通过这一努力，我们为一个有效的SSE方案提供了第一个机械化的安全性证明，并且我们证明了FCF非常适合于对这样复杂的协议进行推理。
papers.title_zh: 可搜索对称加密安全性的机械化证明

papers.title: Probabilistic Program Modeling for High-Precision Anomaly Classification
papers.authors: Kui Xu, Danfeng (Daphne) Yao, Barbara G. Ryder, Ke Tian
papers.abstract: The trend constantly being observed in the evolution of advanced modern exploits is their growing sophistication in stealthy attacks. Code-reuse attacks such as return-oriented programming allow intruders to execute mal-intended instruction sequences on a victim machine without injecting external code. We introduce a new anomaly-based detection technique that probabilistically models and learns a program's control flows for high-precision behavioral reasoning and monitoring. Our prototype in Linux is named STILO, which stands for STatically InitiaLized markOv. Experimental evaluation involves real-world code-reuse exploits and over 4,000 testcases from server and utility programs. STILO achieves up to 28-fold of improvement in detection accuracy over the state-of-the-art HMM-based anomaly detection. Our findings suggest that the probabilistic modeling of program dependences provides a significant source of behavior information for building high-precision models for real-time system monitoring.
papers.abstract_zh: 在先进的现代技术的发展过程中，不断观察到的趋势是它们在隐蔽攻击方面越来越复杂。代码重用攻击(如面向返回的编程)允许入侵者在受害机器上执行恶意指令序列，而无需注入外部代码。我们介绍了一种新的基于异常的检测技术，该技术通过概率建模和学习程序的控制流来进行高精度的行为推理和监控。我们在Linux中的原型被命名为STILO，代表静态初始化的markOv。实验评估涉及真实世界的代码重用利用和来自服务器和实用程序的4000多个测试案例。与最先进的基于HMM的异常检测相比，STILO的检测精度提高了28倍。我们的发现表明，程序依赖的概率建模为构建实时系统监控的高精度模型提供了重要的行为信息源。
papers.title_zh: 高精度异常分类的概率程序建模

papers.title: A Logic of Programs with Interface-Confined Code
papers.authors: Limin Jia, Shayak Sen, Deepak Garg, Anupam Datta
papers.abstract: Interface-confinement is a common mechanism that secures untrusted code by executing it inside a sandbox. The sandbox limits (confines) the code's interaction with key system resources to a restricted set of interfaces. This practice is seen in web browsers, hypervisors, and other security-critical systems. Motivated by these systems, we present a program logic, called System M, for modeling and proving safety properties of systems that execute adversary-supplied code via interface-confinement. In addition to using computation types to specify effects of computations, System M includes a novel invariant type to specify the properties of interface-confined code. The interpretation of invariant type includes terms whose effects satisfy an invariant. We construct a step-indexed model built over traces and prove the soundness of System M relative to the model. System M is the first program logic that allows proofs of safety for programs that execute adversary-supplied code without forcing the adversarial code to be available for deep static analysis. System M can be used to model and verify protocols as well as system designs. We demonstrate the reasoning principles of System M by verifying the state integrity property of the design of Memoir, a previously proposed trusted computing system.
papers.abstract_zh: 接口限制是一种常见的机制，通过在沙箱中执行来保护不受信任的代码。沙箱将代码与关键系统资源的交互限制在一组有限的接口中。这种做法常见于web浏览器、管理程序和其他安全关键系统。受这些系统的启发，我们提出了一个程序逻辑，称为System M，用于建模和证明通过接口约束执行对手提供的代码的系统的安全属性。除了使用计算类型来指定计算的效果之外，System M还包括一个新的不变类型来指定接口限制代码的属性。不变量类型的解释包括其效果满足不变量的术语。我们构造了一个建立在迹上的步进索引模型，并证明了系统M相对于该模型的可靠性。System M是第一个程序逻辑，它允许对执行对手提供的代码的程序进行安全性证明，而不强制对手的代码可用于深度静态分析。System M可用于建模和验证协议以及系统设计。我们通过验证先前提出的可信计算系统Memoir的设计的状态完整性属性来展示系统M的推理原理。
papers.title_zh: 具有接口限制代码的程序逻辑

papers.title: Rational Protection against Timing Attacks
papers.authors: Goran Doychev, Boris Köpf
papers.abstract: Timing attacks can effectively recover keys from cryptosystems. While they can be defeated using constant-time implementations, this defensive approach comes at the price of a performance penalty. One is hence faced with the problem of striking a balance between performance and security against timing attacks. In this paper, we propose a systematic approach for determining the optimal protection against timing attacks, on the example of cryptosystems based on discrete logarithms.
